revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-01 16:26:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add description field in port forwarding API

Problem Description
===================

As users create and update theirs floating ip rules, the reason
behind those rules might get lost throughout time. Moreover, in
an environment with many people writing rules, it is important
to track down the reason behind each one of the rules
created/added in a floating IP port forwarding configuration.
The addition of a description field would allow operators to
determine the reason why a rule was created and help the users
to know if the existence of a rule is still reasonable.

Proposed Change
===============

To address the described scenario, we propose to create a new
“description” field in the Neutron’s Floating IP port forwarding
rules API JSON. This new field will be a nullable String
containing the description/reason why this new port forwarding
rule is being created.

Change-Id: If98a70011b187d2143a660f1f281ab197d21eb4d
Implements: blueprint portforwarding-description
Closes-Bug: #1850818

commit_message:
Add description field in port forwarding API

Problem Description
===================

As users create and update theirs floating ip rules, the reason
behind those rules might get lost throughout time. Moreover, in
an environment with many people writing rules, it is important
to track down the reason behind each one of the rules
created/added in a floating IP port forwarding configuration.
The addition of a description field would allow operators to
determine the reason why a rule was created and help the users
to know if the existence of a rule is still reasonable.

Proposed Change
===============

To address the described scenario, we propose to create a new
“description” field in the Neutron’s Floating IP port forwarding
rules API JSON. This new field will be a nullable String
containing the description/reason why this new port forwarding
rule is being created.

Change-Id: If98a70011b187d2143a660f1f281ab197d21eb4d
Implements: blueprint portforwarding-description
Closes-Bug: #1850818

commit_message:
Revert "Fix for rbd connector to work with ceph octopus"

This reverts commit 3e831480c29c07128f36ae67c44c25177b3d9f36.

This change introduced a heavyweight bindep to os-brick.  We will
replace it with a more lightweight fix.

Change-Id: I9eff1d0d8bab7aaf060d2c009bed2be65d212c04
Partial-bug: #1865754

[{'created': '2020-09-01 20:15:33.000000000', 'message': 'Refer to commit message "footers" not "tags"

Since Git already has an object called a "tag" it's best not to
confuse people by referring to the lines at the end of a commit
message as "tags" too. Instead just call them "footers" but retain
an anchor with the old tags name for that section in case anyone has
hyperlinked it elsewhere.

Change-Id: I13117028949d3e3cf2b1d06f30158e082f904c05
'}]
commit_message:
Refer to commit message "footers" not "tags"

Since Git already has an object called a "tag" it's best not to
confuse people by referring to the lines at the end of a commit
message as "tags" too. Instead just call them "footers" but retain
an anchor with the old tags name for that section in case anyone has
hyperlinked it elsewhere.

Change-Id: I13117028949d3e3cf2b1d06f30158e082f904c05

commit_message:
Ensure updated lb sgs is used on the CRD

When syncing the load balancer security group,
the klb crd is updated with the new security groups,
but the event proceeds to be handled with outdated sgs.
This commit ensures the klb crd resource is updated.

Change-Id: Ia7064bc4b599b8dc05572717f4d80acc03583c20

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-04 14:32:00.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2

Prior to this patch, the metadata_workers parameter defaults to
$os_workers (calculated here [0]) but, even tho it's capped at 12 workers
this number still redundant.

There are a few differences of how the OVN metadata agent works compared
with the OVS metadata agents:

1) The OVN metadata workers are deployed onto the compute nodes and not
   on the controllers/gateways as the OVS ones are. This means it's
   better distributed.

2) Even tho we could have multiple workers, the OVN SB IDL in the OVN
   metadata agents acquires a lock while listening to OVSDB events.
   Therefore, even tho we could have dozens of agents only one of them
   is listening to the events.

3) Instantiating IDLs means maintaining in-memory replicas of the
   OVSDB (or, the tables of that DB that is being watched). This puts a
   burden on OVSDBs to maintain all these replicas updated, reducing
   this number workers also reduces the burden on the OVSDBs.

This patch is reducing the default number of OVN metadata agents to two
(per compute). Two because that keeps it HA, in case the active agente
dies the lock moves to the other one and the service will keep working.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L37

Change-Id: I6b9cc2aff14ce38a56c2757d9ad6c56898e27247
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 847f434140ee8435ee842801748a0deccdff8155)
(cherry picked from commit 2ed6a1936ac71807d650cf26cfbcd9f4330331b6)

commit_message:
[OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2

Prior to this patch, the metadata_workers parameter defaults to
$os_workers (calculated here [0]) but, even tho it's capped at 12 workers
this number still redundant.

There are a few differences of how the OVN metadata agent works compared
with the OVS metadata agents:

1) The OVN metadata workers are deployed onto the compute nodes and not
   on the controllers/gateways as the OVS ones are. This means it's
   better distributed.

2) Even tho we could have multiple workers, the OVN SB IDL in the OVN
   metadata agents acquires a lock while listening to OVSDB events.
   Therefore, even tho we could have dozens of agents only one of them
   is listening to the events.

3) Instantiating IDLs means maintaining in-memory replicas of the
   OVSDB (or, the tables of that DB that is being watched). This puts a
   burden on OVSDBs to maintain all these replicas updated, reducing
   this number workers also reduces the burden on the OVSDBs.

This patch is reducing the default number of OVN metadata agents to two
(per compute). Two because that keeps it HA, in case the active agente
dies the lock moves to the other one and the service will keep working.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L37

Change-Id: I6b9cc2aff14ce38a56c2757d9ad6c56898e27247
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 847f434140ee8435ee842801748a0deccdff8155)
(cherry picked from commit 2ed6a1936ac71807d650cf26cfbcd9f4330331b6)

commit_message:
Fix keys() method output

On py3 keys() attribute for dictionary does not return list. So extra
list filter should be applied to convert output to valid ansible list.

Change-Id: I8997738cefffc01ba6940fe7c5abb1ceeebb78c2

specified in the policy_dirs option (/etc/<config_dir>/policy.d by
default) are not re-applied after the rules from the primary policy file
is re-applied due to a change.

This change introduces additional behavior to make sure the rules from

file.

commit_message:
Reload files in policy_dirs on primary file change

It was determined that rules from policy files located in the directory
specified in the policy_dirs option (/etc/<config_dir>/policy.d by
default) are not re-applied after the rules from the primary policy file
is re-applied due to a change.

This change introduces additional behavior to make sure the rules from
policy_dirs are reapplied if there is a change to the primary policy
file.

Change-Id: I8a6f8e971d881365c41ea409966723319d5b239a
Closes-Bug: #1880959
Related-Bug: #1880847
(cherry picked from commit 75677a31108243e0adddc89f1fbf669053f9573b)
(cherry picked from commit c8c138e69d9189345a7366a10b0779ef70b7250e)
(cherry picked from commit 5904564bf13bbac7d66e00ec6312487c507f09c4)
(cherry picked from commit a49f31d3fc7690e3d15bc2428660b537967c89cc)
(cherry picked from commit 622bcf207948174535b4d04f15ef14fb265c834d)

commit_message:
Adjust scenario tests for NotImplemented skip

This is a patch to restructrue the scenario tests to use the
new skip_if_not_implemented capability.

Change-Id: I49a7fb6650030f2a1115c6d42442062bd33415fd

commit_message:
Fix missing dependency in amphora create flow

Task CertComputeCreate requires SERVER_GROUP_ID but this dependency is
missing when nova anti-affinity is enabled and load balancer topology is
SINGLE. This patch fixes this issue.

Task: 40408
Story: 2007943
Closes-Bug: #1888397

Change-Id: I757d84e4624f488382ec4ff9af3f489cd9a85ed3
(cherry picked from commit ae6f3443594390fd543a007d67b78132e697fb29)

commit_message:
Fix missing params in amphora base and noop driver

Running amphora failover against the amphora noop driver was raising a
TypeError (reload() takes from 2 to 3 positional arguments but 4 were
given).

Change-Id: I64172d6995959cf377364584ad9a2395f9ec0605
(cherry picked from commit 41c628a084002017d2003926cf0e25ba3ffeee0c)

commit_message:
Enable undercloud nova for featureset039

This featureset does not seem to work without nova
on the undercloud. I don't know the details of how
it would work without nova. It can be migrated separately
later.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749679/
Change-Id: Iad3f867009b242b81042d525a7ab9462658cccc7

to be added to the IPA server in order to successfully add DNS entries
and to issue certs with IP SANs (for cinder A/A).

These changes cannot be automated as they require IPA admin or DS
credentials.  This adds a validation to make sure the required

commit_message:
Add validation to check status of ipa server

The latest changes to tls-e require certain permissions and ACIs
to be added to the IPA server in order to successfully add DNS entries
and to issue certs with IP SANs (for cinder A/A).

These changes cannot be automated as they require IPA admin or DS
credentials.  This adds a validation to make sure the required
permissions and ACLs are present before starting an install.

Set molecule test to non-voting for now until
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-validations/+bug/1894882 is resolved.

Change-Id: I03575a5717456ad647cb10825b8d5646a55a6378
(cherry picked from commit 9a20e173447043f70f7eb09afb207d084bc93558)
(cherry picked from commit ffe221f4de2bdd4ef791ebc3fe1a2162174d69d6)

commit_message:
Fix Masakari dashboard policy file location

The horizon image copies the masakari dashboard's policy file to Python
site packages, but it should go to /etc/openstack-dashboard. This allows
the dashboard to be seen by non-admins, although it fails to load.

We get an error like the following in horizon.log:

No policy rules for service 'instance-ha' in
/etc/openstack-dashboard/masakari_policy.json

This change fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I8ede183c76a830de06ce6524dc3f6f6944b182c1
Closes-Bug: #1894240

subject: Update tripleo-validations path to /usr/share/ansible
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 14:22:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update tripleo-validations path to /usr/share/ansible

According to: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/29059/
We decide to converge ansible roles/libraries/plugin and playbooks to
the /usr/share/ansible path instead of having a dedicated path for
validations.
This will avoid duplication since the validation-framework is now
an external framework from tripleo, the common validations between
validations-common and tripleo-validations can be stored at the same
place.

Add a fallback path for Updates and Upgrades

Change-Id: Ibe97d70f4d321d04900ca9fe88144bc16511611c
(cherry picked from commit df0cecfe55b9ce87d4ad5cf49e94298051ee3890)
'}]
commit_message:
Update tripleo-validations path to /usr/share/ansible

According to: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/29059/
We decide to converge ansible roles/libraries/plugin and playbooks to
the /usr/share/ansible path instead of having a dedicated path for
validations.
This will avoid duplication since the validation-framework is now
an external framework from tripleo, the common validations between
validations-common and tripleo-validations can be stored at the same
place.

Add a fallback path for Updates and Upgrades

Change-Id: Ibe97d70f4d321d04900ca9fe88144bc16511611c
(cherry picked from commit df0cecfe55b9ce87d4ad5cf49e94298051ee3890)

commit_message:
Always pass image source info to ironic

To support PXE iscsi root volume boot, image source info should be used
to cache kernel and ramdisk for PXE boot.

Change-Id: I898bd980ab10826a4bedf9669a8c3d38609c98dc
Story: #2008023
Task: #40677

commit_message:
Fix performance issue when updating endpoints

This patch eliminates almost all the manager.py calls when
updating/checking the endpoints from the relation(s) with other charms.

Change-Id: Ibb7999239ec9927e76052b7e45c4545127b5919a
Closes-Bug: #1890602

[{'created': '2020-09-04 08:29:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add default value for kolla_internal_address variable

The "kolla_internal_address" variable is not documented or defined
anywhere. When "kolla_internal_vip_address" is undefined, the error
message is about "kolla_internal_address", which will confuse operators.

This change adds a default value for "kolla_internal_vip_address" when
"kolla_internal_address" is undefined.

Change-Id: I09694b38420ea67896bb8cf4ffd7ce6f131af10e
Closes-Bug: #1864206
(cherry picked from commit b4603d927152f95848e56f6cf3ed4acd88baa377)
'}]
commit_message:
Add default value for kolla_internal_address variable

The "kolla_internal_address" variable is not documented or defined
anywhere. When "kolla_internal_vip_address" is undefined, the error
message is about "kolla_internal_address", which will confuse operators.

This change adds a default value for "kolla_internal_vip_address" when
"kolla_internal_address" is undefined.

Change-Id: I09694b38420ea67896bb8cf4ffd7ce6f131af10e
Closes-Bug: #1864206
(cherry picked from commit b4603d927152f95848e56f6cf3ed4acd88baa377)

commit_message:
Add default value for kolla_internal_address variable

The "kolla_internal_address" variable is not documented or defined
anywhere. When "kolla_internal_vip_address" is undefined, the error
message is about "kolla_internal_address", which will confuse operators.

This change adds a default value for "kolla_internal_vip_address" when
"kolla_internal_address" is undefined.

Change-Id: I09694b38420ea67896bb8cf4ffd7ce6f131af10e
Closes-Bug: #1864206
(cherry picked from commit b4603d927152f95848e56f6cf3ed4acd88baa377)

commit_message:
Add tripleo_nodes_validation role

Convert the all-nodes-validation.sh to a native ansible role. This role
pings the default gateway, checks that controllers are reachable and can
validate that the hostname matches what is in /etc/hosts

Change-Id: I5c1109780f007849c5306adf21fd54b0e9a31494

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-09 07:24:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix serialization of OpenStack actions

* In the recent version 2.3.0 of mistral-lib there has been added
  the new serialization mechanism for actions since the communication
  schema between Mistral engine and Mistral remote executor will soon
  require it (once merged). All classes for OpenStack actions are
  eventually dynamically generated based on the static classes like
  NovaAction, HeatAction etc., so to make the serialization work
  correctly we have to take this into account. The newly added class
  OpenStackActionSerializer takes care of that.

Change-Id: I8d7e2db0b17fb8f055f77363667ca4ab2c501b34

commit_message:
Fix serialization of OpenStack actions

* In the recent version 2.3.0 of mistral-lib there has been added
  the new serialization mechanism for actions since the communication
  schema between Mistral engine and Mistral remote executor will soon
  require it (once merged). All classes for OpenStack actions are
  eventually dynamically generated based on the static classes like
  NovaAction, HeatAction etc., so to make the serialization work
  correctly we have to take this into account. The newly added class
  OpenStackActionSerializer takes care of that.

Change-Id: I8d7e2db0b17fb8f055f77363667ca4ab2c501b34

commit_message:
New native Zuul v3 version of the tempest jobs

Create the jobs in this repository: they will be used from
zaqar repository, not the other way round as it is now.

The jobs have been renamed according the naming guidelines.
The IPv6 jobs has been added here as well to prevent regressions.

Change-Id: Icffb53316e4a7db67db22aef6988f15a3ff79b1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-03 09:24:55.000000000', 'message': 'Spread pacemaker remote resources across cluster.

Use location directives to spread pacemaker remote resources across
cluster. This is to prevent multiple resources being taken down in
the event of a single node failure. This would usually not be a
problem but if the node is being queried by masakari host
monitors at the time the node goes down then the query can hang.

Change-Id: Ib8a667d0d82ef3dcd4da27e62460b4f0ce32ee43
Partial-Bug: #1889094
Depends-On: Ic45dbdd9d8581f25549580c7e98a8d6e0bf8c3e7
'}, {'created': '2020-09-04 09:47:08.000000000', 'message': 'Spread pacemaker remote resources across cluster.

Use location directives to spread pacemaker remote resources across
cluster. This is to prevent multiple resources being taken down in
the event of a single node failure. This would usually not be a
problem but if the node is being queried by masakari host

commit_message:
Spread pacemaker remote resources across cluster.

Use location directives to spread pacemaker remote resources across
cluster. This is to prevent multiple resources being taken down in
the event of a single node failure. This would usually not be a
problem but if the node is being queried by masakari host
monitors at the time the node goes down then the query can hang.

Change-Id: Ib8a667d0d82ef3dcd4da27e62460b4f0ce32ee43
Partial-Bug: #1889094
Depends-On: Ic45dbdd9d8581f25549580c7e98a8d6e0bf8c3e7

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29963, 'name': 'Intel_Zuul', 'display_name': 'Intel Corporation CI', 'email': 'intel-openstack-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'Intel_Zuul'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/devstack on branch stable/ussuri.  The error was:

  Job tempest-full-py3 not defined

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: devstack-platform-fedora-latest
      parent: tempest-full-py3
      description: Fedora latest platform test
      nodeset: devstack-single-node-fedora-31
      voting: false

  in "openstack/devstack/.zuul.yaml@stable/ussuri", line 526, column 3'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-09-08 19:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-09-08 19:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-09-09 06:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Taking ianw's previous -1 as +2 for this version in order to allow updating master to proceed."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 09:08:23.000000000', 'message': 'stable-only: Pin the fedora-latest nodeset to Fedora 31

This rename of the nodeset is required to allow master to move the
original -latest nodeset ahead to Fedora 32 while stable/ussuri remains
on Fedora 31.

Change-Id: I6a66d85b1fc5a4c3f5fa651d33ff08260a87574f
'}, {'created': '2020-09-08 19:17:27.000000000', 'message': 'stable-only: Remove the Fedora 31 based fedora-latest nodeset

This should result in the fedora-latest nodeset from master being used
instead, allowing us to move that nodeset to fedora-32.

Change-Id: I6a66d85b1fc5a4c3f5fa651d33ff08260a87574f
'}]
commit_message:
stable-only: Remove the Fedora 31 based fedora-latest nodeset

This should result in the fedora-latest nodeset from master being used
instead, allowing us to move that nodeset to fedora-32.

Change-Id: I6a66d85b1fc5a4c3f5fa651d33ff08260a87574f

commit_message:
Add os-net-config mappings support

Adds an ansible plug-in that can process the input
in THT parameter 'NetConfigDataLookup' used for the
OsNetConfigMappings resource in tripleo-heat-templates.

Add tasks in the tripleo_network_config role to call the
plug-in and write the result into the default mapping
file for os-net-config.

Change-Id: I968771376cdb3cd2e8e576a4de226b1eccebb23a
Blueprint: bp/nova-less-deploy

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-28 20:51:07.000000000', 'message': "Capturing argparse errors due to problem with cmd2

The Bifrost team got an errors on their CLI that also affects OSC. When in interactive mode,
if argparse fails to parse the input due to, say, a missing parameter, argparse by default
thows a SystemExit(2), but cmd2 doesn't like it because that could've been a signal to stop
the CLI, so it breaks the interactive session. This fix aims to bypass that and keep the CLI
running so we don't have to start it at every parameter we forget to type in.

Change-Id: I0e2006a9625e2f8dbdbc0e5921acfb3853a06ee9
Story: 2008071
Task: 40782
"}, {'created': '2020-08-28 20:53:34.000000000', 'message': "Capturing argparse errors due to problem with cmd2

The Bifrost team got an errors on their CLI that also affects OSC. When
in interactive mode, if argparse fails to parse the input due to, say,
a missing parameter, argparse by default thows a SystemExit(2), but
cmd2 doesn't like it because that could've been a signal to stop the
CLI, so it breaks the interactive session. This fix aims to bypass that
and keep the CLI running so we don't have to start it at every parameter
we forget to type in.

Change-Id: I0e2006a9625e2f8dbdbc0e5921acfb3853a06ee9
Story: 2008071
Task: 40782
"}]
commit_message:
Capturing argparse errors due to problem with cmd2

The Bifrost team got an errors on their CLI that also affects OSC. When
in interactive mode, if argparse fails to parse the input due to, say,
a missing parameter, argparse by default thows a SystemExit(2), but
cmd2 doesn't like it because that could've been a signal to stop the
CLI, so it breaks the interactive session. This fix aims to bypass that
and keep the CLI running so we don't have to start it at every parameter
we forget to type in.

Change-Id: I0e2006a9625e2f8dbdbc0e5921acfb3853a06ee9
Story: 2008071
Task: 40782

commit_message:
Use baremetal provisioning for minimal featureset

This changes fs minimal to use baremetal provisoning.
Also sets 'step_overcloud_prep_flavors' to false
explicitly.

Change-Id: Iec661d0ce3a364263f79d8e4acd5ba47657b3dc3
Closes-Bug: #1894941

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 22:47:14.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6cfaedc6183cf3b29608cf90d2a1b175d4550cb2
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6cfaedc6183cf3b29608cf90d2a1b175d4550cb2

commit_message:
bump pecan to 1.4.0

Neutron recently lifted pecan to 1.4.0 to fix [0], to keep neutron
stadium projects aligned pecan should be bumbed in global requirements
as well.
This patch is more a kind of survey to see how we van progress with it.
The issue which I am aware with pecan 1.4.0 is [1], and resulted in
baning pacan in [3].

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1829042
[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/task/40652
[3] https://review.opendev.org/746261

Closes-Bug: #1894864
Change-Id: Ied3e806102e0100bdbab7b29209d8eff5b003bdd

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate tox based testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40226

Related-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal>

Change-Id: I7decc8f372d76b9fb501cd19ea0355480c6cfd96

commit_message:
Remove deprecated nova::image_service

This parameter was deprecated long ago[1] and has had no effect, so
we're ready to remove it.

[1] b9bb76c089472a42ed846b97a2137b8de4fdda60
Change-Id: I550d12ecdae7d9a14cc0d56fdf1bd43bebbe6e85

vmware-recheck-patch'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-07-31 15:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> > (2 comments)
 > 
 > Sorry, I totally forget that I have to change the branch to ocata
 > release. I will change the branch to ocata and commit again

OK, I see now in the launchpad bug why you want to make the change.

The unfortunate thing is that bug was opened in 2017 and the ocata release is very old by now and went to Unmaintained status on 2020-06-04:

https://releases.openstack.org

So there's not much incentive to change it for ocata at this point in time.

Looking at the old docs for other releases, I do find reference to the placement packaging bug text for:

rocky: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/install/controller-install-rdo.html
queens: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/queens/install/controller-install-rdo.html
pike: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/install/controller-install-rdo.html

And then for ocata, the doc is actually located in the openstack-manuals repo, here:

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals/blob/stable/ocata/doc/install-guide/source/nova-controller-install.rst

If you want to update the doc for rocky for example, you need to follow the instructions for proposing a change to the stable/rocky branch of nova:

https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#proposing-fixes

and use the tag "[stable-only]" as the first word in the commit message.

Then, after that is merged, you would backport the change to stable/queens and stable/pike by following the backport instructions in the stable branch doc ^.'}, {'account_id': 30905, 'date': '2020-07-31 17:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Iad87acf73ef27755c636bdc6ed0b2b829e70201b
Sem-Ver: feature

This is especially interesting when doing a full upgrade, as you might
end in a situation where you don't have any running services on the
undercloud.

This patch will be needed down to stable/train.

Change-Id: Ife48ed6ec5e5ae7c9ff1695c83e1d3312dc1205a
(cherry picked from commit 4c713b189cab4091fec6a53edb3b45a9737546c1)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to pass a static inventory to the validator CLI

This is especially interesting when doing a full upgrade, as you might
end in a situation where you don't have any running services on the
undercloud.

This patch will be needed down to stable/train.

Change-Id: Ife48ed6ec5e5ae7c9ff1695c83e1d3312dc1205a
(cherry picked from commit 4c713b189cab4091fec6a53edb3b45a9737546c1)

[{'created': '2020-08-24 21:01:41.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for lock release during power state change

When power state change is slow, the subsequent provide workflow can
fail because getting a lock on the node times out.

Apparently a node can remain locked for some time after a power state
change, so this issue should be solved by *also* waiting for the node
to be unlocked in the wait_for_power_state action.

Change-Id: I26f23330c50ccf7cb11fb9171d0a82279a497d22
Closes-Bug: #1846791
(cherry picked from commit bc29d7f938179e593403a29510d9989bd52e647c)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for lock release during power state change

When power state change is slow, the subsequent provide workflow can
fail because getting a lock on the node times out.

Apparently a node can remain locked for some time after a power state
change, so this issue should be solved by *also* waiting for the node
to be unlocked in the wait_for_power_state action.

Change-Id: I26f23330c50ccf7cb11fb9171d0a82279a497d22
Closes-Bug: #1846791
(cherry picked from commit bc29d7f938179e593403a29510d9989bd52e647c)

commit_message:
Introduced a service UP check for host to the Rebuild path

Added The check_instance_host decorator before the instance rebuild path
to clearly check if the instance.host status is UP or if it is not UP,
it will end the request.

Change-Id: Iec713402be630ef83619fa596e3551343adff127
Closes-Bug: #1801714

commit_message:
Change [agent]image_download_source=http

As part of the plan to deprecate the iSCSI deploy interface, changing
this option to a value that will work out-of-box for more deployments.

The standalone CI jobs are switched to http as well, the rest of jobs
are left with swift. The explicit indirect jobs are removed.

Change-Id: Idc56a70478dfe65e9b936006a5355d6b96e536e1

commit_message:
Fix handling of default_tag

The previous fix, 589ac8ac0d5a14ce4aa831892d3b0a4a31e29674 was not fully
working as intended because during the templating of the container image
prepare entry, the setting for default_tag was being lost.

This fix simplifies the handling by just checking the initial
mapping_args for the presence of a tag key to determine if the
default_tag flag should be set.

Change-Id: Idfebf62e0e10b709367cfcb6977cf18550a4a4b0
Partial-Bug: #1886547
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b744db900f51416da25ccf923b2105f43f528720)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-02 16:42:42.000000000', 'message': '[TRAIN-Only] Add healthcheck debug flag

This change adds a HEALTHCHECK_DEBUG environment variable to the
common health check script to allow a user to enable debug verbosity
when executing a health check. By default this will be off which should
reduce the amount of logging generated by the container healthchecks.

In order to get verbose mode when running the healthcheck directly, you
can do as follow:

podman exec -u root -ti <container> bash
HEALTHCHECK_DEBUG=1 ./openstack/healthcheck
or
podman -u root -e "HEALTHCHECK_DEBUG=1" <container> /openstack/healthcheck

and enjoy a nice debug output.

Closes-Bug: #1893972
Change-Id: Ia15bca89261fecc857afef13680b05aba77fc8de
'}, {'created': '2020-09-02 16:47:03.000000000', 'message': '[TRAIN-Only] Add healthcheck debug flag

commit_message:
[TRAIN-Only] Add healthcheck debug flag

This is a partial cherry-pick of d03401438c22e59d4f51cedfd0af6d7d48328d45
due the other changes in that commit included more complex changes
which needed further patches to address issues.

This change adds a HEALTHCHECK_DEBUG environment variable to the
common health check script to allow a user to enable debug verbosity
when executing a health check. By default this will be off which should
reduce the amount of logging generated by the container healthchecks.

In order to get verbose mode when running the healthcheck directly, you
can do as follow:

podman exec -u root -ti <container> bash
HEALTHCHECK_DEBUG=1 ./openstack/healthcheck
or
podman -u root -e "HEALTHCHECK_DEBUG=1" <container> /openstack/healthcheck

and enjoy a nice debug output.

Closes-Bug: #1893972
Change-Id: Ia15bca89261fecc857afef13680b05aba77fc8de

commit_message:
[Glusterfs] Fix delete share, mount point not disconnected

When we delete the shared instance, in addition to erasing the data
in the share, we should disconnect the client's mount point to
prevent the data from being written in.

Closes-Bug: #1886010
Change-Id: I7a334fb895669cc807a288e6aefe62154a89a7e4
(cherry picked from commit 9d44ba0b6a2d20be6158ff667ff3b81de31f5cad)

commit_message:
Replace all the bridge_name variables in templates

The bridge_name might be used for multiple times, for example,
in different vlan configurations. All of them should be replaced with
the actual ${bridge_name} variable.

Change-Id: I93ee204a526422f113a88b99531583e3cf769382
Closes-Bug: #1866393
(cherry picked from commit 47ca83280cef1ee6756161176ad3aea8060bb08d)

commit_message:
Expose max_concurrent_builds as a Heat parameter

It can now be set via the use of 'NovaMaxConcurrentBuilds'.

Change-Id: If75b1df0e26a7a3f87be1de9026836a2aa590fe7
Co-authored-By: David J Peacock <david.j.peacock@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Graduate share replication feature

From this patch, share replication feature is no longer considered
experimental. The experimental headers were removed from the share
replication APIs.

DocImpact
Partially-implements: bp graduate-share-replication-feature
Change-Id: Idf8af1c96df373fbcbb4024db490cb4dab42faf7

and _cleanup_running_deleted to improve the cleanup, including

'}, {'created': '2020-07-27 08:49:44.000000000', 'message': 'vpmem enhancement for resource cleanup

a) post_live_migration is invoked to cleanup source host after live
   migration succeeds, and rollback_live_migration is invoked to
   cleanup destination host after live migration fails. If some
   exception occurs, migration status will be set to error and that
   also means source host or destination host might have not finished
   cleanup.
b) there might be orphan instances not being cleaned up.

Currently, we calculate assignments based on tracked instances and
migrations, so we need taking orphan instances and error migrations
into consideration since there may be resources occupied by them but
not cleaned up.

Besides, we update existing periodic task _cleanup_incomplete_migrations
and _cleanup_running_deleted to improve the resource cleanup procedure,
which will cleanup error migrations and orphans.

commit_message:
Introduce a new driver interface 'cleanup_instance'

The driver interface 'delete_instance_files' is removed. This
function takes charge of lingering instance cleanup, including
instance files deletes and whatever we add in the future.

Change-Id: Id553242d61eb167a58cdbea75423a5acf3ca7467
Partially-Implements: blueprint vpmem-enhancement

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-12 03:21:10.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ib5985049235ee1b6018fc172a67e3b05970a6c42
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ib5985049235ee1b6018fc172a67e3b05970a6c42

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate keystone-tempest-plugin jobs to focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Most of the Tempest jobs will be migrate automatically once devstack
base job start running on Focal(Depends-On).

Stable jobs testing stable branch needs to keep running on their supported
distro version which is bionic from stein till ussuri.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I8c7c12202e5fd024999bb2010bb483b0b2582346
Story: #2007865
Task: #40190

commit_message:
Always pass --name when flushing keystone_service

Running "openstack service set <id> --description="
will throw an error [1].

The error occurs because the request to Keystone must include any
of enabled, name or type to satisfy the minProperties of the patch
request.

This patch always sets the --name parameter when calling the openstack
command so that we satisfy this requirement.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/795869/

Change-Id: Ie4e2fe62ee7734f657f765c352ba542360c0e1d7
(cherry picked from commit fc30737487a9bf8b998605455c59f96c7bf99f04)
(cherry picked from commit d33843dc19ae6ffb4321c1d8139bea6444556978)
(cherry picked from commit 09b61ff81753c42d109c192b2f755d8249e34763)
(cherry picked from commit 906178cf1f7543733a0cac1b20fce62acbe278c7)

commit_message:
Expose vhost_custom_fragment

It is provided by the Puppet class 'openstacklib::wsgi::apache'.
This change exposes it for the Octavia service.

Also add Apache WSGI spec tests for default and custom parameters.

Change-Id: I1aee36aa0dee557dda1b65695233728f1a8d3ff1
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 444cb9b583beb1a97de93a168d1289a6875b9b5e)
(cherry picked from commit ab50ae9db55a88c331c9f8af94127e3725477147)

commit_message:
Update "Create and manage shares" doc

This is the basic user guide for manila:

- Update examples and outputs
- Add limits and metadata examples
- Add descriptions about common concepts
  including share type extra specifications
- Add contents for easy navigation

Change-Id: Idf374866a63e0da2c4af3157ac5f471af6173d5e
Closes-Bug: #1652375
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Expose vhost_custom_fragment

It is provided by the Puppet class 'openstacklib::wsgi::apache'.
This change exposes it for the Octavia service.

Also add Apache WSGI spec tests for default and custom parameters.

Change-Id: I1aee36aa0dee557dda1b65695233728f1a8d3ff1
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 444cb9b583beb1a97de93a168d1289a6875b9b5e)

[{'account_id': 32084, 'date': '2020-06-20 00:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-06-20 00:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32084, 'date': '2020-06-20 00:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 32085, 'date': '2020-06-24 00:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32084, 'date': '2020-06-24 17:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-06-24 22:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > This is looking good. One concern I have is about the other

 > 
 > How can we hook them in to use the new metrics extensions?
 > One issue I see is the current metrics extension is requiring an
 > amphora ID. Do we need that? Can we abstract this interface to only
 > need a listener ID?

I believe we do -- the DB version needs to store things based on amphora ID, so it needs this info. We could make it ... generic somehow? [{'created': '2020-06-20 00:44:12.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Refactoring amphora stats driver interface

Previously the stats driver was responsible for parsing the health
message, which should have been done prior to passing the stats to the
driver interface.

Co-Authored-By: Stephanie Djajadi <stephanie.djajadi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Refactoring amphora stats driver interface

Previously the stats driver was responsible for parsing the health
message, which should have been done prior to passing the stats to the
driver interface.

Removed the driver interface for the health updater because it is core
Octavia functionality.

Stats drivers is now a singleton and can load multiple drivers.

Both the amphora health manager AND provider statistics should use the
new driver interface.

Co-Authored-By: Stephanie Djajadi <stephanie.djajadi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3a013aebd1eb89cd4f983fbf4f8ae8d6639548cd

subject: Support basic auth for image registry
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-09-04 12:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-09-08 13:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-04 12:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Support basic auth for image registry

If you stand up a docker-distribution registry, basic auth can be
configured with tls to lock down the registry. Currently the only auth
method that is supported is the bearer tokens used by the public
registries.  This change checks the www-authentication header to see if
we should try basic auth or the bearer token auth.

Change-Id: I57599ab3cd8773ae3312930145b9e84244940f41
Closes-Bug: #1893826
(cherry picked from commit 0c73e4f3eb310a90cc37ba8d0aba9c27ca50989b)
'}]
commit_message:
Support basic auth for image registry

If you stand up a docker-distribution registry, basic auth can be
configured with tls to lock down the registry. Currently the only auth
method that is supported is the bearer tokens used by the public
registries.  This change checks the www-authentication header to see if
we should try basic auth or the bearer token auth.

Change-Id: I57599ab3cd8773ae3312930145b9e84244940f41
Closes-Bug: #1893826
(cherry picked from commit 0c73e4f3eb310a90cc37ba8d0aba9c27ca50989b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-04 07:22:40.000000000', 'message': "Replace union to create tcp-check list for redis

When using union, repeated arrays members are removed, so in this case
we are missing a 'expect string +ok' after the QUIT. To avoid that i'm

Change-Id: I8f92469aa8dd0b8c21821b3ec62b2d43361ee428
(cherry picked from commit 3130cc880a1f714ee8b38855f471b85a18834c1d)
"}, {'created': '2020-09-04 11:53:48.000000000', 'message': "Replace union to create tcp-check list for redis

When using union, repeated arrays members are removed, so in this case
we are missing a 'expect string +ok' after the QUIT. To avoid that i'm
usinhg + operator to join arrays.

Change-Id: I8f92469aa8dd0b8c21821b3ec62b2d43361ee428

"}]
commit_message:
Replace union to create tcp-check list for redis

When using union, repeated arrays members are removed, so in this case
we are missing a 'expect string +ok' after the QUIT. To avoid that i'm
usinhg + operator to join arrays.

Change-Id: I8f92469aa8dd0b8c21821b3ec62b2d43361ee428
(cherry picked from commit 3130cc880a1f714ee8b38855f471b85a18834c1d)

Add security context template at pod/container level for etcd chart

This change implements runAsUser flag at pod level and readOnly-fs
flag at container level

Change-Id: Idcb78a1125b51e3b2a71c8cab0e97246c3f1c5aa

commit_message:
Replace cradox with rados

cradox is not maintained anymore, rados is the proper
replacement, e.g used in cinder.

This is transparent for end users, no further action is
required.

Change-Id: I199eb50463d2bc8232c2c6db627bb24ba7bbbb75

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 19262, 'name': 'Liron Kuchlani', 'email': 'lkuchlan@redhat.com', 'username': 'lkuchlan'}, {'_account_id': 21884, 'name': 'DellEMC Unity CI', 'email': 'emc.unity.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-unity-ci'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25243, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'username': 'NetApp-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30002, 'name': 'Douglas Viroel', 'email': 'viroel@gmail.com', 'username': 'dviroel'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-01-05 10:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-01-05 15:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The idea is good and needed, but it needs more work.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-01-06 10:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for working on this Liron!'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-01-06 10:59:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I used check-uuid for generate uuids.
But there are two problems with this script:
1. In some cases it doesn't add uuid for tests.
2. In some cases it places the decorator import (from tempest.lib import decorators) in inappropriate line number."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-02-19 21:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Needs a rebase, and for Zuul to pass. 
You'll get more reviews/views if you can get Zuul to +1 this patch. 

That said, I am of the view that fully qualified test names are unique and will achieve the goal this effort is seeking to solve. Is this a hard requirement coming from tempest? If yes, is this enforceable by some test?

What new things does a manila developer need to know in order to ensure they stay compliant after this change merges? Can you please add some documentation/instructions? Can this act of assigning and managing UUIDs be done by automation/CI? 

Since you're committing to a branchless project, what impact will this have on different versions of Manila?

Please feel free to answer these here, or during the manila meeting on openstack-meeting-alt on freenode.net at 15:00 UTC on Thursdays - please place an item in the meeting agenda before the meeting: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Manila/Meetings#Next_meeting

Alternatively, you could also bring this up on the Openstack-discuss mailing list."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-02-19 23:12:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

One of the use cases of this I was told, outside of this review was that this approach aims to work towards fixing issues with DDT and randomization of test case names... 


The problem is that DDT names stuff like this:

    test_somethingxyz_{ordinal}_{data}

and if the *data* is an unnamed tuple/dictionary, the order of those values is completely random. 

For example:

   https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/a3b6f7ad25fcb8b97915cfad27effaf0d350dbe7/manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_access_rules_metadata_negative.py#L77-L81

We don't we explicitly naming DDT cases?

We have a small framework in manila that allows us to pass 'named structures' down to ddt in unit tests, and ddt will promptly use that in the test case name: https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/20e89b9691a5416e585245dd9c36702930a9e14b/manila/tests/utils.py#L29-L77

Example usage: https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/4249e94c6bb7f5efb1a2095c925398277046936d/manila/tests/share_group/test_api.py#L286-L296

So, in this case, instead of hash randomization changing the order of parameters on us, we'd just have the following format, that we can possibly live with?
    
     test_somethingxyz_{ordinal}_{custom_name}


Downside I see is that it's a manual process and would add a non-trivial maintainer burden..."}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-02-20 09:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:03:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Needs a rebase, and for Zuul to pass.
 > You'll get more reviews/views if you can get Zuul to +1 this patch.

I think it depends on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701352/.

 > 
 > That said, I am of the view that fully qualified test names are
 > unique and will achieve the goal this effort is seeking to solve.
 > Is this a hard requirement coming from tempest? If yes, is this
 > enforceable by some test?
It's part of the tempest coding guide and, as far as I know, there was no needs for tests so far:
https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

 > 
 > What new things does a manila developer need to know in order to
 > ensure they stay compliant after this change merges? Can you please
 > add some documentation/instructions? Can this act of assigning and
 > managing UUIDs be done by automation/CI

You can just link the document above.

 > 
 > Since you're committing to a branchless project, what impact will
 > this have on different versions of Manila?

No impact: it adds something more."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:06:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> One of the use cases of this I was told, outside of this review was
 > that this approach aims to work towards fixing issues with DDT and
 > randomization of test case names...

This is exactly the same use case which is in the commit description, maybe not spelled out properly:
"track a specific test over time" because right now the test names are random.

 > The problem is that DDT names stuff like this:
 > 
 > test_somethingxyz_{ordinal}_{data}
 > 
 > and if the *data* is an unnamed tuple/dictionary, the order of
 > those values is completely random.
 > 
 > For example:
 > 
 > https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/src/commit/a3b6f7ad25fcb8b97915cfad27effaf0d350dbe7/manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_access_rules_metadata_negative.py#L77-L81
 > 
 > We don't we explicitly naming DDT cases?
 > 
 > We have a small framework in manila that allows us to pass 'named
 > structures' down to ddt in unit tests, and ddt will promptly use
 > that in the test case name: https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/20e89b9691a5416e585245dd9c36702930a9e14b/manila/tests/utils.py#L29-L77
 > 
 > Example usage: https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/4249e94c6bb7f5efb1a2095c925398277046936d/manila/tests/share_group/test_api.py#L286-L296
 > 
 > So, in this case, instead of hash randomization changing the order
 > of parameters on us, we'd just have the following format, that we
 > can possibly live with?
 > 
 > test_somethingxyz_{ordinal}_{custom_name}
 > 
 > 
 > Downside I see is that it's a manual process and would add a
 > non-trivial maintainer burden...

Interesting; if ddt allows people to pass data, maybe it could pass also additional metadata (so the UUIDs).'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:26:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Needs a rebase, and for Zuul to pass.
 > > You'll get more reviews/views if you can get Zuul to +1 this
 > patch.
The code is updated.
I created a separated patch and edited the Change-Id to the same id.   


 > I think it depends on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701352/.
Right, thanks"}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-02-20 12:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-03-21 00:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-07-26 04:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-07-26 10:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Was it there any further discussion leading to dropping this patch?'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-07-26 10:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

No, the patch stands for a long time and and there seems to be no interest in it.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-07-26 17:11:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> No, the patch stands for a long time and and there seems to be no
 > interest in it.

That's the case for many patches which ends up being merged if they are raised and discussed at the appropriate time.
See the lifecycle of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/548936/, for example."}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-07-27 11:06:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > No, the patch stands for a long time and and there seems to be no

 > example.

True we just have to be determined.
I will try to raise it again.
Thanks!!!"}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-07-28 04:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-07-28 04:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2020-07-28 08:59:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sorry I didn't notice import order before, we were discussing your change to tempest on the #openstack-qa channel, and I thought this might need a re-look..."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-07-31 15:02:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Hi Liron, thank you for proposing this! I found some tests that don't have uuid:

test_list_security_services[api,positive]
test_list_security_services_detailed_filter_by_ss_attributes[api,positive]
test_list_security_services_filter_by_share_network[api,positive]
test_list_security_services_with_detail[api,positive]
test_list_share_networks[api,gate,positive,smoke]
test_list_share_networks_all_filter_opts[api,positive]
test_list_share_networks_filter_by_ss[api,positive]
test_list_share_networks_like_filter[api,positive]
test_list_share_networks_with_detail[api,positive]
test_try_list_share_networks_all_tenants[api,positive]
test_try_list_share_networks_project_id[api,positive]"}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-07-31 15:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

$ expr `grep "def test_*" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests | wc -l` - `grep "@decorators.idempotent_id" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests | wc -l`
11

It seems that only those 11 tests are missing uuid at this moment. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-07-31 16:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> $ expr `grep "def test_*" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests | wc -l` - `grep "@decorators.idempotent_id" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests | wc -l`
> 11
> It seems that only those 11 tests are missing uuid at this moment. Thanks!

Good find! I think this is the same problem as the insertion of the decorator - UUIDs aren't being processed for files where there are no tempest imports.'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-07-31 17:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > $ expr `grep "def test_*" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests | wc -l`
 > - `grep "@decorators.idempotent_id" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests |
 > wc -l`
 > > 11
 > > It seems that only those 11 tests are missing uuid at this
 > moment. Thanks!
 > 
 > Good find! I think this is the same problem as the insertion of the
 > decorator - UUIDs aren't being processed for files where there are
 > no tempest imports.

True!

$ expr `find manila_tempest_tests/tests -name "test_*.py" | wc -l` - `grep "from tempest.lib import decorators" -r manila_tempest_tests/tests | wc -l`
0

It seems that all test files already have the tempest import.'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-08-02 09:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-08-02 10:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks guys for noticing.
It's been a long time since I touched "check-uuid" patch [1].
I noticed that there is a problem in cases where there is no tempest import at all.
I fixed the script locally in my env and I think it also works ok for manila-tempest-plugin.
I'll update patch [1] soon.
Regarding the missing uuids, this because the class inherits from object, means it is 
not a subclass of unittest.TestCase, so "check-uuid" does not discover the tests under
this class.
I manually added uuids for those tests but we should fix those classes.

commit_message:
Add uuid for tests

We should add a unique identifier for manila tests like
done in tempest. This will help to track a specific
test over time.
This patch adds a unique id for all functional and scenario
tests and also adds check-uuid to tox tests.

Change-Id: I262c7df709a8a7e9ed36591571069b9bcef0f51c

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-14 19:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-14 19:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

I *think* this will pass the gate now, but I need to think more about what happens with EC...'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-14 21:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-14 22:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-17 04:40:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

recheck

So the probe test failed because while we're looping in https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.25.0/test/probe/test_reconstructor_rebuild.py#L357-L369 2/6 primaries returned 200, while 4/6 404. (There were also 2 404s from handoffs, but those get ignored because they're expected to 404.) Previously, this would've responded 404, but with this change we ignore one of the 404s so there's no quorum. OTOH, I'm *sure* this could trip a 503 on a 3-3 split on master, too.

I feel like we should either

* add a sleep that's long enough that we can avoid the busy-loop, or
* expect and retry some number of 503s."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-17 04:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-17 15:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-08-17 18:25:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(6 comments)

this all mostly seems in order - I'm going to play with that test for the ec 404 to 503 durable fix"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-17 18:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-20 23:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-08-24 21:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-08-24 21:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I was flailing and not entirely done, but I wanted to shelve this and do something else - hopefully I didn't make it significantly worse

I'd really like the config var name to change"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-25 06:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the rebase and added test coverage! Will address the option name in the morning.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-28 20:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-08-28 22:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-02 17:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(4 comments)

Tests look great, new behavior is great and code changes seem obvious to me.

I love the new name - hopefully I've also got at least tim's tacit approval that it makes sense... maybe rebalance_missing_tolerance_count would have been better </bikeshedding> :rofl:"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-02 18:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-02 22:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

Gate's gonna fail, but it's just a (newly-added) flakey test."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-03 19:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-04 00:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-05 16:20:55.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Client should retry primary quroum of errors

Change-Id: If4bd39788642c00d66579b26144af8f116735b4d
'}, {'created': '2020-08-13 23:25:24.000000000', 'message': "Client should retry when there's just one 404 and a bunch of errors

During a rebalance, it's expected that we may get a 404 for data that
does exist elsewhere in the cluster. Normally this isn't a problem; the
proxy sees the 404, keeps digging, and one of the other primaries will
serve the response.

Previously, if the other replicas were heavily loaded, the proxy would
see a bunch of timeouts and the fresh (empty) primary, treat the 404 as
good, and send that on to the client.

Now, have the proxy throw out that first 404 (provided it doesn't have a
timestamp); it will then return a 503 to the client, indicating that it
should try again.

Add a new proxy-server config option, ignore_rebalance_404s; operators
may use this to increase the number of 404-no-timestamp responses to
discard if their rebalances are going faster than replication can keep
up, or set it to zero to return to the previous behavior.

Change-Id: If4bd39788642c00d66579b26144af8f116735b4d
"}, {'created': '2020-08-14 19:56:45.000000000', 'message': "Client should retry when there's just one 404 and a bunch of errors

does exist elsewhere in the cluster. Normally this isn't a problem; the
proxy sees the 404, keeps digging, and one of the other primaries will
serve the response.

Previously, if the other replicas were heavily loaded, the proxy would
see a bunch of timeouts and the fresh (empty) primary, treat the 404 as
good, and send that on to the client.

Now, have the proxy throw out that first 404 (provided it doesn't have a
timestamp); it will then return a 503 to the client, indicating that it
should try again.

Add a new (per-policy) proxy-server config option, ignore_rebalance_404s;
operators may use this to increase the number of 404-no-timestamp
responses to discard if their rebalances are going faster than
replication can keep up, or set it to zero to return to the previous
behavior.

Change-Id: If4bd39788642c00d66579b26144af8f116735b4d

the number of 404-no-timestamp responses to discard if their rebalances
are going faster than replication can keep up, or set it to zero to
return to the previous behavior.

commit_message:
Client should retry when there's just one 404 and a bunch of errors

During a rebalance, it's expected that we may get a 404 for data that
does exist elsewhere in the cluster. Normally this isn't a problem; the
proxy sees the 404, keeps digging, and one of the other primaries will
serve the response.

Previously, if the other replicas were heavily loaded, the proxy would
see a bunch of timeouts and the fresh (empty) primary, treat the 404 as
good, and send that on to the client.

Now, have the proxy throw out that first 404 (provided it doesn't have a
timestamp); it will then return a 503 to the client, indicating that it
should try again.

Add a new (per-policy) proxy-server config option,
rebalance_missing_suppression_count; operators may use this to increase
the number of 404-no-timestamp responses to discard if their rebalances
are going faster than replication can keep up, or set it to zero to
return to the previous behavior.

Change-Id: If4bd39788642c00d66579b26144af8f116735b4d

commit_message:
Change "propagate_uplink_status" default value to True

When "uplink-status-propagation" extension is enabled, new ports
created will default the value of "propagate_uplink_status" to True.

Closes-Bug: #1888487

Change-Id: If1e533a61aeebbb4761d669c516fe86a4381765c

commit_message:
[devstack] Collector Variable

The collector is configurable via the CLOUDKITTY_COLLECTOR variable, no
CLOUDKITTY_GNOCCHI is available.

Change-Id: If433bb26e64747e887af3b191cfae36f31390809
Signed-off-by: Abraham Arce <abraham.arce.moreno@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1449d76472734de18f86c42ccb625d8306687c6b)

speed, but since Nova's server groups do not support adding existing VMs,
Octavia cannot support use of the spares pool with the Active-Standby

commit_message:
Deprecate the Spares Pool feature for removal in X

Use of the spares pool was originally recommended to increase provisioning
speed, but since Nova's server groups do not support adding existing VMs,
Octavia cannot support use of the spares pool with the Active-Standby
topology. Since this is our recommended topology for production deployments,
and speed is less essential in development/testing environments (the
only place we could recommend the use of Single topology), the overhead of
maintaining spares pool support exceeds its theoretical usefulness.

Change-Id: I7375e9758c7ae80e2370189117e8e63c79446490

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 13:25:05.000000000', 'message': "Volume backup response schemas are incorrect

Change I2ab6ecfeb0c48c7ef4a0fc94e670d43dbc3f6650 added response
schemas for volume backup responses. The schema specifies the 'name'
as type string in the response for create-backup and update-backup,
but the name is not required in the create request and the cinder
backup service does not supply one. This element should be string
or null.

Change-Id: I032e54a2065859d4ebc0969faccf68494fe745bc
Closes-bug: #1894844
"}]
commit_message:
Volume backup response schemas are incorrect

Change I2ab6ecfeb0c48c7ef4a0fc94e670d43dbc3f6650 added response
schemas for volume backup responses. The schema specifies the 'name'
as type string in the response for create-backup and update-backup,
but the name is not required in the create request and the cinder
backup service does not supply one. This element should be string
or null.

Change-Id: I032e54a2065859d4ebc0969faccf68494fe745bc
Closes-bug: #1894844

around https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-net/blob/e11d72cc5/sdk/src/Core/Amazon.Runtime/Internal/Auth/AWS4Signer.cs#L553-L565 ...

We probably want a similar case-insensitive comparison when creating buckets, around https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.25.0/swift/common/middleware/s3api/controllers/bucket.py#L347 -- what do you think the behavior should be for the GetBucketLocation api? Continuing to send whatever value is in the config seems reasonable, I suppose...

Should we support the converse and tolerate a client misconfigured and sending something signed with US-East-1 when the cluster is configured for us-east-1?"}, {'account_id': 29586, 'date': '2020-07-27 01:34:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

That's right. As you say, it would be nice to have the location modulated on lines 289 and 336. And, if a defense condition is added to the case that the location is set to lower case, I think your concerns will be solved.

[{'created': '2020-07-22 00:55:36.000000000', 'message': 'Allow lowercase region name for AWS .NET SDK compatibility

Change-Id: Ifb58b854b93725ed2a1e3bbd87f447f2ab40ea91
'}, {'created': '2020-07-22 01:01:57.000000000', 'message': "Allow lowercase region name for AWS .NET SDK compatibility

When I call the S3 API using the AWS .NET SDK, I get the following error.

An error occurred (AuthorizationHeaderMalformed) when calling the ListBuckets operation: The authorization header is malformed; the region 'regionone' is wrong; expecting 'RegionOne'

The reason is that the AWS .NET SDK generates a signature by changing the region name to lowercase. (AWS region names are all lowercase.)
The default region name of OpenStack is RegionOne, and custom region names with capital letters can also be used.
If you set the location of the S3 API to a region name containing uppercase letters, the AWS .NET SDK cannot be used.

There are two ways to solve this problem.

1. Force the location item of S3 API middleware setting to be set to lower case.
2. If the request contains credentail parameters that contain the lowercase region name, the region name of string_to_sign is modified to lowercase to generate a valid signature.

I think the second way is to make it more compatible.

Change-Id: Ifb58b854b93725ed2a1e3bbd87f447f2ab40ea91

commit_message:
s3api: Allow lower-cased region name for AWS .NET SDK compatibility

When I call the S3 API using the AWS .NET SDK, I get the following error.

An error occurred (AuthorizationHeaderMalformed) when calling the
ListBuckets operation: The authorization header is malformed;
the region 'regionone' is wrong; expecting 'RegionOne'

The reason is that the AWS .NET SDK generates a signature by changing
the region name to lowercase. (AWS region names are all lowercase.)
The default region name of OpenStack is RegionOne, and custom region
names with capital letters can also be used.
If you set the location of the S3 API to a region name containing
uppercase letters, the AWS .NET SDK cannot be used.

There are two ways to solve this problem.

1. Force the location item of S3 API middleware setting to be set
   to lower case.
2. If the request contains credentail parameters that contain the
   lowercase region name, the region name of string_to_sign is
   modified to lowercase to generate a valid signature.

I think the second way is to make it more compatible.

Closes-Bug: #1888444
Change-Id: Ifb58b854b93725ed2a1e3bbd87f447f2ab40ea91

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

If we move horizon jobs to focal then zun-ui 'nodejs-test' job
fails. This patch adds libfontconfig1 in bindep.txt as phantomjs
requires libfontconfig[1] to fix failed nodejs job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/744647/

[1] https://www.npmjs.com/package/phantomjs-prebuilt#linux-note

Change-Id: Idf9a1be6fe81215de91f012f534c765e360e2330

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40190

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.h>

Change-Id: Ieada47b1455e635208bafe12168fadcb65bc72b9

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886296
Bump the pyflakes to 2.1.1 as min version to run pep8 jobs
on py3.8 which is default python vesion in ubuntu focal.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734700/

Story: #2007865
Task: #40180

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html
Change-Id: I482ac98bc56f0e3cfb8b767f47649da11ed1afab

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-02 09:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor the failover flows

This patch refactors the failover flows to improve the performance
and reliability of failovers in Octavia.

Specific improvements are:
* More tasks and flows will retry when other OpenStack services are
  failing.
* Failover can now succeed even when all of the amphora are missing
  for a given load balancer.
* It will check and repair the load balancer VIP should the VIP
  port(s) become corrupted in neutron.
* It will cleanup extra resources that may be associated with a
  load balancer in the event of a cloud service failure.

This patch also removes some dead code.

Conflicts:
    octavia/common/constants.py

commit_message:
Refactor the failover flows

This patch refactors the failover flows to improve the performance
and reliability of failovers in Octavia.

Specific improvements are:
* More tasks and flows will retry when other OpenStack services are
  failing.
* Failover can now succeed even when all of the amphora are missing
  for a given load balancer.
* It will check and repair the load balancer VIP should the VIP
  port(s) become corrupted in neutron.
* It will cleanup extra resources that may be associated with a
  load balancer in the event of a cloud service failure.

This patch also removes some dead code.

Conflicts:
    octavia/common/constants.py

Change-Id: I04cb2f1f10ec566298834f81df0cf8b100ca916c
Story: 2003084
Task: 23166
Story: 2004440
Task: 28108
(cherry picked from commit 955bb8840616d96ed74de3086f8959ad4190a472)

commit_message:
WIP - use os_net_config module from host_prep_tasks

This is a work in progress to extract the os-network-config execution
out of the Heat stack and done by Ansible via the host_prep_tasks
interface.

While writting this, I realized we probably need a role to convert
network/scripts/run-os-net-config.sh so we cover all the actions made by
this scripts; not just calling os-net-config.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/748754
Change-Id: I139aa706563641377dc670e49b81b995b9c5a18a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-01 11:55:29.000000000', 'message': 'Allow 4byte ASNs in dynamic routing client

Neutron-dynamic-routing has the bgp_4byte_asn extension which allows
4byte ASNs to be used, increasing the range of valid AS numbers. Since
we cannot easily tell beforehand whether that extension is available,
allow for the maximal interval to be used by clients and let the API
validate the input.

Change-Id: Ib4695272784b4a5ebbcb792cfec82dac3ef6f3cf
'}]
commit_message:
Allow 4byte ASNs in dynamic routing client

Neutron-dynamic-routing has the bgp_4byte_asn extension which allows
4byte ASNs to be used, increasing the range of valid AS numbers. Since
we cannot easily tell beforehand whether that extension is available,
allow for the maximal interval to be used by clients and let the API
validate the input.

Change-Id: Ib4695272784b4a5ebbcb792cfec82dac3ef6f3cf

commit_message:
Add aggressive negotiation mode for ikepolicy

The phase1 negotiation mode adds support for aggressive mode,
which can be selected when creating an ikepolicy.

Change-Id: I8148011558094db07b5f9eba70b16cfe6eeaf98f
Partial-Bug: #1701413

commit_message:
[WIP][collectd][ansible] Add template to deploy collectd using ansible

All heat params have been copied over, there are a bunch
that are used for conditionals.
The outputs and conditionals secions in *-puppet do a lot
of configuration, and provides lists of defaults for
puppet. These will be moved to ansible, role is WIP at [1] and [2]

TODO: Add in the part where configuration is done.

[1] https://github.com/infrawatch/tripleo-collectd-ansible-role
[2] https://github.com/infrawatch/collectd-config-ansible-role

Change-Id: I9939a524795bb3fbc63e44f203f851dadeb7c30a

Update the vars passed to ansible

Change-Id: I851677b176aa5a3bea4e0033bca5e86cd75e7507

One cannot assume systemd is being used during installation.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix install on systems without systemd

This broke Kolla already.
One cannot assume systemd is being used during installation.

Package installations normally reload systemd themselves
if they need to.

Backport to Ussuri.

Change-Id: Iafc3e14eaf3e8341eb7d2af30c460bbee1c9c104
Story: 2008112
Task: 40828
(cherry picked from commit 5e7f72a49a300b06fbadc14846f8f44905d39253)

commit_message:
Add an upgrade check for YAML oslo policy file

Oslo policy is deprecating[1] the JSON file format for oslo policy
files.
This patch adds an upgrade check that includes a warning if a JSON
policy file is being used with Octavia.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/733650

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/733650
Change-Id: I293a30ddef77c09808a204c87a594a91bb6992da

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Failover abilities legacy improvements

Change failover commands to run against the remote array
instead of the primary array. Add in addtitional validation
to prevent failback attempts if the primary array is no
longer available on the Unisphere instance. Part one of
the failover abilities feature updates which is split
into legacy changes and new functionality.

Change-Id: I755acd0c56158557f53b23f8ba7361c621172428
Partially-implements: blueprint powermax-failover-abilities
