revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 18:20:55.000000000', 'message': "Handle oslo.messaging ping endpoint

We have a test that attempts to emulate a messaging endpoint and
fails if anything other than the endpoint's target property is
inspected. With the addition of the ping endpoint in
I51cf67e060f240e6eb82260e70a057fe599f9063, this now blows up
with the latest oslo.messaging release.

To handle this situation, our fake class just needs to also
check for the oslo_rpc_server_ping attribute.

Change-Id: I485c1724614abf03928b83280c88ffc4cdfdb1c4
Co-Authored-By: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle oslo.messaging ping endpoint

We have a test that attempts to emulate a messaging endpoint and
fails if anything other than the endpoint's target property is
inspected. With the addition of the ping endpoint in
I51cf67e060f240e6eb82260e70a057fe599f9063, this now blows up
with the latest oslo.messaging release.

To handle this situation, our fake class just needs to also
check for the oslo_rpc_server_ping attribute.

Change-Id: I485c1724614abf03928b83280c88ffc4cdfdb1c4
Co-Authored-By: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add share resize scenario tests for CephFS Native

The missed dependency to enable share resize scenario tests
already landed. This patch removes the tempest blacklist directive.

Also fix the tempest regex we use. We should include both api
and scenario tests.

Change-Id: I7959860ddf0a1e559732f7acbe541df2466a42b6

commit_message:
Deprecate neutron_api_config

Currently puppet-neutron provides 2 resource types, neutorn_api_config
and neutron_api_paste_ini, to manage the same file.
(/etc/neutron/api-paste.ini)
This patch deprecates neutron_api_config so that we can solve this
duplication in a future release. Historically neutron_api_config was
added before neutron_api_paste_ini, but in puppet-openstack modules
we use *_conf type to manage *.conf  file in general, so its name is
confusing.

This patch also removes the implementation to clean up authtoken
parameters in api-paste.ini, because that implementation was added
to deal with parameter migration from api-paste.ini to neutron.conf,
which happened a long ago.

Change-Id: I4361ea53bd964a3a4861c4c28abb7063e19ebd94

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-26 12:51:39.000000000', 'message': 'Allow the container build tools to run config-less

This change allows the container build tools to run without a
provided configuration file. The container configuration file
still in service was derived from our old kolla implementation
which no longer needs to exist. The build process will now
simply walk the build path and build all containers found when
a configuration file is not defined or present. Logging has
been added to inform the user of the tools discoveries which
should provide a nice user experience when running container
builds.

In the event a container configuration file is used, the tools
will now ensure all dependent images are inherently part of the
build preparation.

Tests have been updated to ensure that the client is operational
in both a config and config-less situation.

Change-Id: I89aebb0ae9734b0371bd3fdbd34643babfcca8f3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4d23eee41e86cd52c3d6c62e86e10daec582213e)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the container build tools to run config-less

This change allows the container build tools to run without a
provided configuration file. The container configuration file
still in service was derived from our old kolla implementation
which no longer needs to exist. The build process will now
simply walk the build path and build all containers found when
a configuration file is not defined or present. Logging has
been added to inform the user of the tools discoveries which
should provide a nice user experience when running container
builds.

In the event a container configuration file is used, the tools
will now ensure all dependent images are inherently part of the
build preparation.

Tests have been updated to ensure that the client is operational
in both a config and config-less situation.

Change-Id: I89aebb0ae9734b0371bd3fdbd34643babfcca8f3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4d23eee41e86cd52c3d6c62e86e10daec582213e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-25 22:10:35.000000000', 'message': "Support cinder multiple stores

This patch updates the location URL of the legacy images while
upgrading from single cinder store to multiple stores.
It does that with the help of lazy loading logic i.e. while
GET images call, it checks the location URL and metadata
of the image against the configured store ids and updates
images to respective stores on the basis of volume type (comparing
image-volume's type with the configured cinder_volume_type).
Legacy image URL:
cinder://<volume-id>

commit_message:
Support cinder multiple stores

This patch updates the location URL of the legacy images while
upgrading from single cinder store to multiple stores.
It does that with the help of lazy loading logic i.e. while
GET images call, it checks the location URL and metadata
of the image against the configured store ids and updates
images to respective stores on the basis of volume type (comparing
image-volume's type with the configured cinder_volume_type).
Legacy image URL:
cinder://<volume-id>
New image URL:
cinder://<store-id>/<volume-id>

NOTE: bumping lower-constraints/requirements of glance-store to 2.3.0 as
it includes changes[1] that are a hard requirement for cinder multiple
stores to work with glance

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/746556/

Change-Id: I087a89c20813378fea8ff22ddf81d7a10c220db3
Implements: blueprint multiple-cinder-backend-support

subject: Find security group profiles by project scope
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-03 00:28:07.000000000', 'message': "Find security group profiles by project scope

If a security group exists with the same name in multiple projects, a
profile will not be able to created using that security group name.
This change will try to scope the security group to the user's project
during validation.  If the security group can not be found using the
project scope, it will try to find it without the project scope.

Change-Id: I595b3c348ce8133a273d8e26c664fffc32694705
"}, {'created': '2020-09-03 00:33:19.000000000', 'message': "Find security group profiles by project scope

If a security group exists with the same name in multiple projects, a
profile will not be able to created using that security group name.
This change will try to scope the security group to the user's project
during validation.  If the security group can not be found using the

Change-Id: I595b3c348ce8133a273d8e26c664fffc32694705
"}]
commit_message:
Find security group profiles by project scope

If a security group exists with the same name in multiple projects, a
profile will not be able to created using that security group name.
This change will try to scope the security group to the user's project
during validation.  If the security group can not be found using the
project scope, it will try to find it without the project scope.

Change-Id: I595b3c348ce8133a273d8e26c664fffc32694705

commit_message:
Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run
only against signle host, if they should run or not now.

Change-Id: Iac06d3f02b1c9ee5e3bfbd28043fbb70d8b1d328

commit_message:
Add a meta_version_to_write parameter

This parameter is useful to handle upgrades from prior versions of
swift when crypto is enabled. See this patch commit header for more info:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742033/

Change-Id: Icd321e03e5055044b2dba9c9fee191cb9546dd60

commit_message:
Move equality check into LibvirtConfigGuestInterface

This is a pure refactoring that moves the equality check of
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface objects from get_interface_by_cfg() into the
class itself.

Later this pattern will be extended to LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI objects
to support detaching direct physical interfaces where PCI address based
equality is needed.

Part of blueprint sriov-interface-attach-detach

Change-Id: I6ce9457179f65f82ff721b315e51a67ebd879673

Change-Id: I618ea5083da29e7188c093c96f40ca3db6f9e5cc

commit_message:
Fix neutron-server default serial

By default we should prevent all neutron server going down at the same time
Instead we should apply approach where we upgrade single neutron server
and the rest of hosts next time
to decrease API downtime

Additionally changed default for neutron_other_serial, to safe 1
 as in case of big amount of network nodes, several l3 agents may
went down at the same time, and make ha router unavaliable.

Change-Id: I618ea5083da29e7188c093c96f40ca3db6f9e5cc

commit_message:
Fix Extension gates by supporting Skip Execption in test case.

The test test_delete_auto_allocated_topology is the only
test in patrole that does a Skip test exception in the test_ method
so I had to add support to the rbac_rule_validation decorator
so the framework would allow the skip exception to be thrown
through the decorator and make it through to the unittest
framework as a skip. Let me know if anyone has a better
way to do this.  I am just trying to get all of the gates running.

FYI I am down to one testing in multinode that is only
supported by system scoped token in Nova so I think that
we will have to wait until tempest supports scope token and
then when patrole support them we should be able to get all
voting gate and non voting gates to work.

https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008018

Change-Id: Id8a599c8754dfc10ffa5fa18c232a9afff180a8e
Story: 2008018
Task: 40670

commit_message:
Add Puppet Litmus and remove Puppet 5 testing

This patch adds the needed bits to replace Beaker
with Puppet Litmus.

Since Puppet Litmus only supports Puppet 6 we
need to remove Puppet 5 testing. The probability
that we break Puppet 5 support (we have promised
to keep it in Victoria) this late in the cycle is
very low hence we should try to get this through.

When this is merged we can move all modules over
to use Litmus and then cleanup all Beaker things.

Change-Id: I73f18345ed3e6481f86ad7af7d68f66b19d2250e

The config section [keystone_auth] is used for service user, which is
different from [keystone_authtoken]. They used to be managed in the same
class, but after the deprecation in Change
I0cea57dd58b4ddc532ee28a045ec4b75b8312919, magnum can no longer fall
back to use the values in keystone_authtoken/admin_user [1]

We add a new class to manage [keystone_auth] of the config, to keep it
distinct from keystone_authtoken

commit_message:
New class to support keystone_auth config

The config section [keystone_auth] is used for service user, which is
different from [keystone_authtoken]. They used to be managed in the same
class, but after the deprecation in Change
I0cea57dd58b4ddc532ee28a045ec4b75b8312919, magnum can no longer fall
back to use the values in keystone_authtoken/admin_user [1]

We add a new class to manage [keystone_auth] of the config, to keep it
distinct from keystone_authtoken

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/stable/train/magnum/common/keystone.py#L122-L123

Change-Id: Ib1fe977a151346cd2ab29ad33d7d9dbb86413fe6

commit_message:
Preupgrade check for amphorav2 provider

Added checks if amphorav2 provider enabled - persistence backend
and jobboard backend configured properly.

Also small fix of parameter name in ZookeeperTaskFlowDriver.

Change-Id: I9342801bbbc7ec2c99e8698504a2b4c28bc00526

commit_message:
Remove the base layers

This change removes the base layers from our configuration file. This
is being done to simplify the container build process and lighten the
configs we carry.

In a future review we'll remove the config all together as it is no
longer required.

Depends-On: I5e200be27a5e49bb119c46e4a2b7968952ac0ed2
Change-Id: I968a6e88e266a2d3937be74695b6b4fe2694e745
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Fix `tox -epep8` for python3.8 users
messages: [{'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2020-08-31 15:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2020-08-31 15:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32108, 'date': '2020-09-01 08:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2020-09-08 18:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\nTested under python 3.7.7.'}, {'account_id': 10644, 'date': '2020-09-08 18:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10644, 'date': '2020-09-08 18:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-31 15:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix `tox pep8` for python3.8 users

For those who have default python3 pointing to 3.8
an error occurs for `tox pep8` as it tries to
use older pyflakes that has bug when running under
python3.8.

commit_message:
Fix `tox -epep8` for python3.8 users

For those who have default python3 pointing to 3.8
an error occurs for `tox -epep8` as it tries to
use older pyflakes that has bug when running under
python3.8.

Bump `hacking` to later versions where the bug
is fixed.

Change-Id: I7bdde5c67b41be2c9fed92e2713ef22399013169

commit_message:
Set 'old_flavor', 'new_flavor' on source before resize

Cross-cell resize is confusing. We need to set this information ahead of
time.

Change-Id: I5a403c072b9f03074882b552e1925f22cb5b15b6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1879878

commit_message:
Add response schema validation for volume manage

This is to add response schema validation for volume manage.
As gmann pointed out in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/616783/,
the response of volume_manage is same as that of show_volume,
so here we use common_show_volume directly.

Change-Id: I5e26d0cca87c303ebb9a2fe93ad0b13b73eb41a6
partially-implements: blueprint volume-response-schema-validation

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40219

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal>

Change-Id: I9774a78bbb4cbeee17bb09386cbddede1222c970

Remove the old scripts which are not needed anymore.

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 port of the legacy functional job

The name of the job now follows the guidelines.
Remove the old scripts which are not needed anymore.

Also, even though OS_TENANT_NAME is still exported,
read OS_PROJECT_NAME as first choice.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/746235
Change-Id: I2d698e4f7c38e010cfef2961446914fff136b181

commit_message:
Expand generic reproducer for bug #1879878

This shows that this bug doesn't affect cross-cell resize in the same
way, but does highlight some gaps we need to close.

Change-Id: Iee2c5521f41a2d061d21d4556cfbf7a898ad96c9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1879878

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iec5723b7aad90b11ae2998cf6f2797470a8886c7
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iec5723b7aad90b11ae2998cf6f2797470a8886c7

commit_message:
add functional regression test for bug #1888395

This change adds a funcitonal regression test that
assert the broken behavior when trying to live migrate
with a neutron backend that does not support multiple port
bindings.

Change-Id: I470a016d35afe69809321bd67359f466c3feb90a
Partial-Bug: #1888395

commit_message:
Granular metering data in neutron-metering-agent

Extend neutron metering agent to generate Granular metering data.
The rationale here is to have data (bytes and packets) not just in
a label basis, but also in tenant, router, and router-label, and tenant-label
basis. This allows operators to develop more complex network monitoring
solutions.

Moreover, I added documentation to explain what is the neutron metering agent,
its configs, and different message formats.

Change-Id: I7b6172f88efd4df89d7bed9a0af52f80c61acbe0
Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/granular-metering-data
Closes-Bug: #1886949

When SwiftRawDisks is set, try to mount the disks using uuids instead of
paths. This makes mounts more stable, eg. if a kernel gets updates and
device orders are changed.

This patch will also update existing entries in /etc/fstab and replaces
the device path with the corresponding UUID.

'}]
commit_message:
Use UUID for mounted SwiftRawDisks

When SwiftRawDisks is set, try to mount the disks using uuids instead of
paths. This makes mounts more stable, eg. if a kernel gets updates and
device orders are changed.

This patch will also update existing entries in /etc/fstab and replaces
the device path with the corresponding UUID.

Change-Id: I275b962447015e804638ccf85c63a22d1bb6e3d6
(cherry picked from commit 6206d195928e11de4672404720e137422d619cad)

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8
support in their later version.

This patch updates python version to py38 in karma.conf.js file
as py36 is not avaialbale on focal. It also adds libfontconfig1
in bindep.txt as phantomjs requires libfontconfig[2].

Story: #2007865
Task: #40201

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal
[2] https://www.npmjs.com/package/phantomjs-prebuilt#linux-note

Change-Id: I4a70b7fd1ed4b94ffaed34b73779659b24e1eb65

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8
support in their later version.

- noqa for pep8 F811 check.

Closes-Bug: #1886298

Story: #2007865
Task: #40194

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal

Change-Id: Id8300f4dbde7e59b8d6275b0671328e35670312c

Works fine for me.
I was having trouble finding the issue with my rebuild operation, the error message initially stated 
`Error: Unable to rebuild instance`
which isn't much helpful i debugging (i'm already aware that the operation failed),
After applying the patch the error message got descriptive stating,
`Error: Unable to rebuild instance: Image 3a479a7c-32a8-49a0-8e10-227516e4a178 is unacceptable: Unable to rebuild with a different image for a volume-backed server. (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-a9462161-f018-46c9-a017-2006743f1f30)`

I think the formatting could be enhanced (HTTP status, Request-ID could be separated in a better way) and be decided which information is useful to show like "is Request-ID important info for UI?"
but let's leave it to Horizon team to decide.
Also it will be great if we could add verbosity level to it so the type of user (developer, operator) could customize UI messages as per their usage.
LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-09-03 07:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2019-09-10 22:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Vishal, exposing exceptions in the UI definitely helps understand the cause of the problem. Exception details often get lost in the current Horizon exception handling. However, if I remember correctly,  exposing the ugly details in the UI was discouraged when Horizon was still in its hayday. One alternative I can think of is to use LOG.error(ex) so the exception details will be definitely captured in the log.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-09-11 05:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Gloria Thanks for the feedback, waiting for other core-reviewer feedback and will update patch accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-11 09:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I would suggest to clarify merits and demerits the proposed appraoch first.
We need a design discussion. It is more than a code review.

 > as mine.
 > 
 > I wrote down my understanding and thoughts at https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/horizon-error-messages-revisit.
 > It would be a good starting point.
@Motoki San, I totally agree, it is a sticky issue which has been dragging. There is no easy solution. etherpad note is a good idea to organize the thoughts. 
Just FYI,  our horizon customers are usually cloud admins, whenever there are something wrong, they will check the logs and files on the controllers. Adding LOG.error(ex) helped us resolve issues when originally there were no clues.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-13 05:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi all reviewers,
I am waiting for your feedback on this patch. right now it works for only 1 scenario. If it looks good then i will do the same changes for the rest of the code and fix failed test cases.
How to test:
1) Open instance panel under project dashboard.
2) then try to detach a volume under action tab
3) Now an error will raise and you will be redirected to instance page and an alert box will appear and for detailed error msg you can click on details anchor tag.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-02-12 14:31:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I have some nitpicks about naming/language, but apart from that one important change I would like to request.

Instead of replacing the handle() methods with error(), why not just add a show_exception argument to handle(), so that it can show the errors properly by itself? You wouldn't have to change so much code then, you would just add that parameter where you want the exception to be visible."}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-02-12 14:58:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > I have some nitpicks about naming/language, but apart from that one
 > important change I would like to request.
 > 
 > Instead of replacing the handle() methods with error(), why not
 > just add a show_exception argument to handle(), so that it can show
 > the errors properly by itself? You wouldn't have to change so much
 > code then, you would just add that parameter where you want the
 > exception to be visible.

 > (3 comments)
 > 
 > I have some nitpicks about naming/language, but apart from that one
 > important change I would like to request.
 > 
 > Instead of replacing the handle() methods with error(), why not
 > just add a show_exception argument to handle(), so that it can show
 > the errors properly by itself? You wouldn't have to change so much
 > code then, you would just add that parameter where you want the
 > exception to be visible.

Yeah, I agree with you but when i added a new parameter(i.e details) in handle it does not work for me.

exceptions.handle use django messages framework which doesn't include the extra detail parameter.

currently django stores the messages in fallback store(first cookie store and if message exceeds 2048 bytes then session store)
the session store keeps the messages in request and prints on screen after redirection.
Currently i couldn't find a way to customize the stored message.
So that's why i used messages.error() and render to redirect."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-02-12 15:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

That creates a lot of problems. First of all, handle() does more than just displaying messages — in particular, it handles re-logging and such. Second, if you render a page instead of redirecting, the URL will be wrong, and it will work bad with caching and bookmarks.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-02-12 16:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2019-08-26 15:46:06.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor-error-messages for project panel

Error messages can come from different projects(cinder, keystone, nova, etc.),
but we are currently catching all the exceptions and return a generic error
message and it hard for the user to determine the source of error. This patch
refactoring the error message and shows the detailed error message on the
horizon UI.

Partially-Implements refactor-error-messages

commit_message:
Cleanup for Refactor-error-messages

This patch is a clean-up patch for refactor-error-messages bp
which remove the exception message from base message otherwise
the same exception message display twice like
this https://ibb.co/XyFWMdz .

Partially-Implements blueprint refactor-error-messages

Change-Id: I46b632dbb6701785e7d654feff336a27d6ecea9c

commit_message:
[devstack] Collector Variable

The collector is configurable via the CLOUDKITTY_COLLECTOR variable, no
CLOUDKITTY_GNOCCHI is available.

Change-Id: If433bb26e64747e887af3b191cfae36f31390809
Signed-off-by: Abraham Arce <abraham.arce.moreno@intel.com>

commit_message:
Deperecate support for Xen and VMWare

The XenAPIDriver driver[1] and the vmwareapi driver[2] were deprecated
in nova, so support for these drivers should be also deprecated.

[1] af280ffe3098b84123eae218989ea056e9935bf1
[2] d98d72828505d250698fcab7cd310820b3a52f7a

Change-Id: Ie9d815b7b3377a9641cc80d11bf6df329331388a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 06:27:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add tripleo_ha_wrapper role

This role is meant to help moving the HA pcs tasks to pure deployment
steps run on the host and not in containers any more. We tested this
ansible review with the THT patches at
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/tripleo-heat-templates+branch:master+topic:pcs_host3

Here is the testing protocol that was used in order to verify we did
not break anything:
1) Deployed overcloud + tempest
2) Ran a successful redeploy
2.1) Verified that a redeploy restarted containers globally when the
     configuration for the service changed
2.2) Verified that a redeploy did not restart containers which config
     did not change
2.3) Verified that the ordering of restarting bundles allows for
     brownfield deployments (i.e. first the bundle is restarted due
     to new bind-mounts and then the bundle is restarted with new
     configuration)
2.4) Verified that converge step after minor update is successful
3) Ran an initial successful minor update
3.1) Verified that the new image is indeed being run by pacemaker
     (i.e. :pcmklatest tag is applied to the new containers)
3.2) Verified that after converge no container is restarted
4) Re-run a subsequent successful noop minor update
4.1) Verify that containers are not restarted a second time after
     the cluster is stopped and started

Depends-On: I367cf4b65300be8dca0190b9adeab549018d4a56

NB: Not 100% clean in zuul.d/molecule.yaml

Change-Id: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696
Related-Bug: #1863442

(cherry picked from commit 8daba50a383d303f8b991ca1b3c79c46cf73a85b)

commit_message:
Add tripleo_ha_wrapper role

This role is meant to help moving the HA pcs tasks to pure deployment
steps run on the host and not in containers any more. We tested this
ansible review with the THT patches at
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/tripleo-heat-templates+branch:master+topic:pcs_host3

Here is the testing protocol that was used in order to verify we did
not break anything:
1) Deployed overcloud + tempest
2) Ran a successful redeploy
2.1) Verified that a redeploy restarted containers globally when the
     configuration for the service changed
2.2) Verified that a redeploy did not restart containers which config
     did not change
2.3) Verified that the ordering of restarting bundles allows for
     brownfield deployments (i.e. first the bundle is restarted due
     to new bind-mounts and then the bundle is restarted with new
     configuration)
2.4) Verified that converge step after minor update is successful
3) Ran an initial successful minor update
3.1) Verified that the new image is indeed being run by pacemaker
     (i.e. :pcmklatest tag is applied to the new containers)
3.2) Verified that after converge no container is restarted
4) Re-run a subsequent successful noop minor update
4.1) Verify that containers are not restarted a second time after
     the cluster is stopped and started

Depends-On: I367cf4b65300be8dca0190b9adeab549018d4a56

NB: Not 100% clean in zuul.d/molecule.yaml
    Small tweaks/renames to molecule folder for CI

Change-Id: Iaa7e89f0d25221c2a6ef0b81eb88a6f496f01696
Related-Bug: #1863442
(cherry picked from commit d5782863b8b1da748da3e6914ff4281e6103f29b)
(cherry picked from commit 8daba50a383d303f8b991ca1b3c79c46cf73a85b)

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove '[vnc] keymap', '[spice] keymap' options

These options were deprecated way back in Rocky due to buggy behavior
they introduced. We can remove them now.

Change-Id: I9266edfd4ea6315239c54ff8d91e37d197c760c0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-24 06:11:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix networking in swift_copy_rings container

Swift rings are sync'ed by up- and downloading them to the undercloud,
making sure every node on the overcloud has the same copy to start with.

Before Train, the swift_copy_rings container had no explicit network
setting, and this was working because of using some defaults. However,
this has changed with [1][2], and the container now needs "net: host" to
successfully up- and download the rings to the undercloud.

A regular deployment won't notice the failure until a node gets replaced
or a manually modified ring is used.

[1] 87bc72a37cf70a3b1548a4c6614768c2efe8f79c
[2] b1fda5e8bb90e6aa505d9989b31574fcd5defe31

Closes-Bug: 1892674
Change-Id: Ib56f59b7d2a981196eab334108d42ca4390c0566
'}, {'created': '2020-09-03 09:27:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Swift ring file synchronization issue

Swift ring files are synchronized by up- and downloading them to the
undercloud, making sure every node on the overcloud has the same copy to
start with.

One (optional) step in the process is to ensure rings are in sync before
uploading them eventually. swift-recon is used to query all Swift object
storage nodes, get the md5sum of the ring files and compare them with
the local ring file md5sum.

However, in containerized deployments this will fail, because Swift
containers are not immediately restarted after rebalancing. The object
server will return the md5sum of the previous ring version, which does
not match with the rebalanced local file. TripleO is intended to skip
this check by setting skip_consistency_check to false.

However, the parameter was never set to false, and this patch fixes it.

Running an overcloud update immediately after an initial deployment was
not affected by this. Same for multiple overcloud updates - subsequent
updates did fix this issue automatically. In the first case the rings
were not rebalanced due to min_part_hours not passed, in the latter case
they were synchronized on the subsequent update.

Closes-Bug: 1892674
Change-Id: Ib56f59b7d2a981196eab334108d42ca4390c0566
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift ring file synchronization issue

Swift ring files are synchronized by up- and downloading them to the
undercloud, making sure every node on the overcloud has the same copy to
start with.

One (optional) step in the process is to ensure rings are in sync before
uploading them eventually. swift-recon is used to query all Swift object
storage nodes, get the md5sum of the ring files and compare them with
the local ring file md5sum.

However, in containerized deployments this will fail, because Swift
containers are not immediately restarted after rebalancing. The object
server will return the md5sum of the previous ring version, which does
not match with the rebalanced local file. TripleO is intended to skip
this check by setting skip_consistency_check to false.

However, the parameter was never set to false, and this patch fixes it.

Running an overcloud update immediately after an initial deployment was
not affected by this. Same for multiple overcloud updates - subsequent
updates did fix this issue automatically. In the first case the rings
were not rebalanced due to min_part_hours not passed, in the latter case
they were synchronized on the subsequent update.

Closes-Bug: 1892674
Change-Id: Ib56f59b7d2a981196eab334108d42ca4390c0566

If a security group exists with the same name in multiple projects, a
profile will not be able to created using that security group name.
This change will try to scope the security group to the user's project
during validation.  If the security group can not be found using the
project scope, it will try to find it without the project scope.

Change-Id: I595b3c348ce8133a273d8e26c664fffc32694705

commit_message:
Find security group profiles by project scope

If a security group exists with the same name in multiple projects, a
profile will not be able to created using that security group name.
This change will try to scope the security group to the user's project
during validation.  If the security group can not be found using the
project scope, it will try to find it without the project scope.

Change-Id: I595b3c348ce8133a273d8e26c664fffc32694705

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: If20aa86f21807497c5dfefb0f34f771040517c6f

commit_message:
Do not assume that prepare_image is the last command to run

The get_deploy_steps command can be run after it breaking deploy.

Change-Id: I8e641a521a574462010a95a19e8a64ac36d4e52d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-31 13:41:06.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Deprecate support for non-QEMU/KVM backends

None of these backends has had upstream testing in a very long time, if
ever, and their usage levels are unknown. Deprecate them now so that we
can at least remove the worst of them (UML, Xen) in the next cycle.

Change-Id: Id5b15aa846a5ddaf4ac26fe586327aef8c08c89d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Deprecate support for non-QEMU/KVM backends

None of these backends has had upstream testing in a very long time, if
ever, and their usage levels are unknown. Deprecate them now so that we
can at least remove the worst of them (UML, Xen) in the next cycle.

Change-Id: Id5b15aa846a5ddaf4ac26fe586327aef8c08c89d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create documentation for tests

Generate documentation for each test from its docstring.

The sphinx-apidoc tool is used to generate the .rst
files necessary for the generation of the documentation.

When the documentation is being build only functions that
start with "test" are passed to the resulting documentation.

Change-Id: I1878f67e10df9bb1f8289beda8e59a56b5057fe4

commit_message:
Add support for GET /v2/dataframes API endpoint to the client

Support for the ``GET /v2/dataframes`` endpoint has been added
to the client. A new ``dataframes get`` CLI command is also available.

Story: 2005890
Task: 36384

subject: [OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2
messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-09-04 14:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-08 12:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-09-08 13:28:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-04 14:32:21.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2

Prior to this patch, the metadata_workers parameter defaults to
$os_workers (calculated here [0]) but, even tho it's capped at 12 workers
this number still redundant.

There are a few differences of how the OVN metadata agent works compared
with the OVS metadata agents:

1) The OVN metadata workers are deployed onto the compute nodes and not
   on the controllers/gateways as the OVS ones are. This means it's
   better distributed.

2) Even tho we could have multiple workers, the OVN SB IDL in the OVN
   metadata agents acquires a lock while listening to OVSDB events.
   Therefore, even tho we could have dozens of agents only one of them
   is listening to the events.

3) Instantiating IDLs means maintaining in-memory replicas of the
   OVSDB (or, the tables of that DB that is being watched). This puts a
   burden on OVSDBs to maintain all these replicas updated, reducing
   this number workers also reduces the burden on the OVSDBs.

This patch is reducing the default number of OVN metadata agents to two
(per compute). Two because that keeps it HA, in case the active agente
dies the lock moves to the other one and the service will keep working.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L37

Change-Id: I6b9cc2aff14ce38a56c2757d9ad6c56898e27247
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 847f434140ee8435ee842801748a0deccdff8155)
(cherry picked from commit 2ed6a1936ac71807d650cf26cfbcd9f4330331b6)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Change the default metadata_workers to 2

Prior to this patch, the metadata_workers parameter defaults to
$os_workers (calculated here [0]) but, even tho it's capped at 12 workers
this number still redundant.

There are a few differences of how the OVN metadata agent works compared
with the OVS metadata agents:

1) The OVN metadata workers are deployed onto the compute nodes and not
   on the controllers/gateways as the OVS ones are. This means it's
   better distributed.

2) Even tho we could have multiple workers, the OVN SB IDL in the OVN
   metadata agents acquires a lock while listening to OVSDB events.
   Therefore, even tho we could have dozens of agents only one of them
   is listening to the events.

3) Instantiating IDLs means maintaining in-memory replicas of the
   OVSDB (or, the tables of that DB that is being watched). This puts a
   burden on OVSDBs to maintain all these replicas updated, reducing
   this number workers also reduces the burden on the OVSDBs.

This patch is reducing the default number of OVN metadata agents to two
(per compute). Two because that keeps it HA, in case the active agente
dies the lock moves to the other one and the service will keep working.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L37

Change-Id: I6b9cc2aff14ce38a56c2757d9ad6c56898e27247
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 847f434140ee8435ee842801748a0deccdff8155)
(cherry picked from commit 2ed6a1936ac71807d650cf26cfbcd9f4330331b6)

commit_message:
Fix dogtag functional job

Use the correct service name so that dogtag will actually get installed.

Drop the mozilla-nss-devel pkg which no longer exists for Fedora 31.

TODO: The job will still fail because devstack replaces the system
python3-six pkg with some updated version, but pkispawn runs with
"python3 -I" which ignores user-installed libs, causing it to fail
with a "Cannot import six" error.

Change-Id: I6cdab2d58f47650f296f8e79ee718647c3160142

[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:34:11.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Iff25bf057492ab20c114e9b89a22bed6ca12ba3e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Iff25bf057492ab20c114e9b89a22bed6ca12ba3e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update tripleo-validations path to /usr/share/ansible

According to: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/29059/
We decide to converge ansible roles/libraries/plugin and playbooks to
the /usr/share/ansible path instead of having a dedicated path for
validations.
This will avoid duplication since the validation-framework is now
an external framework from tripleo, the common validations between
validations-common and tripleo-validations can be stored at the same
place.

Add a fallback path for Updates and Upgrades

Change-Id: Ibe97d70f4d321d04900ca9fe88144bc16511611c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-21 17:38:18.000000000', 'message': "post live migration: don't call Neutron needlessly

In bug 1879787, the call to network_api.get_instance_nw_info() in
_post_live_migration() on the source compute manager eventually calls
out to the Neutron REST API. If this fails, the exception is
unhandled, and the migrating instance - which is fully running on the
destination at this point - will never be updated in the database.
This update normally happens later in
post_live_migration_at_destination().

The network_info variable obtained from get_instance_nw_info() is used
for 2 things: notifications - which aren't critical - and unplugging
the instance's vifs on the source - which is very important!

It turns out that at the time of the get_instance_nw_info() call, the
network info in the instance info cache is still valid for unplugging
the source vifs. The port bindings on the destination are only
activated by the network_api.migrate_instance_start() [1] call that
happens shortly *after* the problematic get_instance_nw_info() call.
In other words, get_instance_nw_info() will always return the source
ports. Because of that, we can replace it with a call to
instance.get_network_info().

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/network/neutron.py#L2837-L2866

Change-Id: If0fbae33ce2af198188c91638afef939256c2556
Closes-bug: 1879787

commit_message:
post live migration: don't call Neutron needlessly

In bug 1879787, the call to network_api.get_instance_nw_info() in
_post_live_migration() on the source compute manager eventually calls
out to the Neutron REST API. If this fails, the exception is
unhandled, and the migrating instance - which is fully running on the
destination at this point - will never be updated in the database.
This update normally happens later in
post_live_migration_at_destination().

The network_info variable obtained from get_instance_nw_info() is used
for two things: notifications - which aren't critical - and unplugging
the instance's vifs on the source - which is very important!

It turns out that at the time of the get_instance_nw_info() call, the
network info in the instance info cache is still valid for unplugging
the source vifs. The port bindings on the destination are only
activated by the network_api.migrate_instance_start() [1] call that
happens shortly *after* the problematic get_instance_nw_info() call.
In other words, get_instance_nw_info() will always return the source
ports. Because of that, we can replace it with a call to
instance.get_network_info().

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/d9e04c4ff0b1a9c3383f1848dc846e93030d83cb/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L2493-L2522

Change-Id: If0fbae33ce2af198188c91638afef939256c2556
Closes-bug: 1879787

Thanks, Liron, a waiter seems like a good idea -- some comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-08-05 21:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Liron, I still don't like this approach because it introduces two new configuration options... Why would we care if the IP address has been added or not, really?

Currently, before attempting to mount the share, we perform a ping test in most of the scenario tests (https://github.com/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/blob/f8894b6f0b3d98394d6c573a065ac10baa7e621c/manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/test_share_basic_ops.py#L47-L52)

There's another validation ping checker that already exists in our scenario test manager code (https://github.com/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/blob/7636a1fce4c2b49a03338097f110fadbb3f81206/manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/manager.py#L390-L425)

If you reuse this ping checker, you can make the tests wait until the export location IP is pingable with tempest.conf's config option: "[validation]/ping_timeout" (https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/sampleconf.html#tempest-sampleconf)

You can then add this ping test to all the scenario tests; we only use it in the tests in the module: "manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/test_share_basic_ops.py" - this way you'll achieve what you need.'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-08-06 11:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-08-06 11:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-08-06 11:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Ping to export location until it is reachable

In some cases it takes time for the interface to acquire the
IP address. This causes a failure in the ping operation.
Therefore, we should ping until the network is reachable.
This is can be done by "call_until_true" method that allows
reusing the ping method until the defined timeout.

This patch also adds the other scenario tests for ipv6
environmet.

Change-Id: I60bf3bd1bd2cc22b5bb6be11c8174b7529d0a066

commit_message:
[TRAIN-only] Allow to pass a static inventory

This is especially interesting when you're doing an update/upgrade, and
haven't any running services on the undercloud node at some step (LEAPP
for instance).
You can now generate your inventory beforehand, and pass it to the
validator directly.

Note: train-only because the code here has diverged from what we have in
master and ussuri. A master patch has been pushed in parallel:
https://review.opendev.org/749915

Change-Id: I9bb8cd8dbdc0ddbc9784240931f87dc58bf601d1

subject: trilio: Support multiple NFS share configurations
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-09-08 10:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2020-09-08 13:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-08 10:52:44.000000000', 'message': 'trilio: Support multiple NFS share configurations

TrilioVault supports use of multiple NFS shares using a comma
separated list.  Update the ghost-nfs-share action code to
support this type of configuration.

The assumption is that the order of shares provided to the
action is the same as the order of shares in the nfs-shares
configuration option in terms of replication between sites.

Mismatched length lists will generate an exception which can
be propagated back to the operator.

Change-Id: I7d501a3e44d4e7c732e7625fa2a8cde9a34ff564
Closes-Bug: 1894817
'}]
commit_message:
trilio: Support multiple NFS share configurations

TrilioVault supports use of multiple NFS shares using a comma
separated list.  Update the ghost-nfs-share action code to
support this type of configuration.

The assumption is that the order of shares provided to the
action is the same as the order of shares in the nfs-shares
configuration option in terms of replication between sites.

Mismatched length lists will generate an exception which can
be propagated back to the operator.

Change-Id: I7d501a3e44d4e7c732e7625fa2a8cde9a34ff564

commit_message:
Allow to pass a static inventory to the validator CLI

This is especially interesting when doing a full upgrade, as you might
end in a situation where you don't have any running services on the
undercloud.

This patch will be needed down to stable/train.

Change-Id: Ife48ed6ec5e5ae7c9ff1695c83e1d3312dc1205a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-31 14:22:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove Etcd from DCN roles that don't need it

Remove the Etcd service from DCN roles that do not need it. Etcd is
only required by the cinder-volume service in order to run in active/
active mode. Roles that do not host the cinder-volume service do not
need Etcd.

Change-Id: Ia24eed019ba973aad0e8f5b7fc0d53c1ee4149e8
"}]
commit_message:
Remove Etcd from DCN roles that don't need it

Remove the Etcd service from DCN roles that do not need it. Etcd is
only required by the cinder-volume service in order to run in active/
active mode. Roles that do not host the cinder-volume service do not
need Etcd.

Change-Id: Ia24eed019ba973aad0e8f5b7fc0d53c1ee4149e8

This proposed a release for openstacksdk to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Victoria going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, Sept 7.

Change-Id: I5f6bf17267fde5a45d78ad7c96abeb203c2f825a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Release final openstacksdk for Victoria

This proposed a release for openstacksdk to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Victoria going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, Sept 7.

Change-Id: I5f6bf17267fde5a45d78ad7c96abeb203c2f825a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set Bridge Information for NSX Integration

VM interfaces need to connect to a nsx-specific bridge vs the default
of br-int in order for NSX integration to be successful.

Change-Id: I152d9d4d161f18336d9b412d578846f749a0162b

(2 comments)

Looking nice, just a couple of queries about reducing the need for specific config overrides with a bit more automation.'}, {'account_id': 22093, 'date': '2020-08-28 20:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Looking nice, just a couple of queries about reducing the need for
 > specific config overrides with a bit more automation.

We can do that. In order to add the nova_network_type we have to update os_nova under the same topic.

dhcp_agent_notification can be a simple jinja if/else for that. It looks like NSX is the only one not requiring it.'}, {'account_id': 22093, 'date': '2020-08-28 20:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 22093, 'date': '2020-08-28 20:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2020-08-30 07:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-08-30 08:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-09-01 09:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 22093, 'date': '2020-09-01 12:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Failing again intermittently Unit nspawn-macvlan.service could not be found.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-09-01 13:28:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> Failing again intermittently Unit nspawn-macvlan.service could not
 > be found.

Thats just spurious noise from our log collection not finding that service (because in this scenario it's not running). The actual error is a nova-compute stack trace which seems to be hitting a lot of our centos-7 jobs like this https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a038834887194c4ab6f94dec06d5ab91/log/logs/host/nova-compute.service.journal-10-42-23.log.txt#2729"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-09-01 13:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Add Initial NSX Integration

Default variables are established to add NSX integration to OSA,
as well as documentation on how to implement the integration.

[{'created': '2020-05-30 14:32:37.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I6be1174686cb1d8f11e8cb4be58c0e739bf0f931

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I6be1174686cb1d8f11e8cb4be58c0e739bf0f931

commit_message:
[CI] Remove setup_gate.sh symlink

This is confusing as it is not meant to be used by users.
Also, various tools show duplicated matches due to both locations
containing the exact same content.

Change-Id: I2debe121f64954e57788270d3258775f29f1cbb0

commit_message:
pass vifs_already_plugged when reverting a migration

When migrations and resize operations are in resize_verify
the source vm and all of it networking are still intact and we
have not yet started the vm on the destination host.

As such when we revert the interfaces are already plugged
so we should set vifs_already_plugged when invoking
_create_guest_with_network on revert since we have not
towrn down the host netowrking.

Change-Id: I135085c927b192568fea75dc6859c37bec3bf515
Related-Bug: #1734320
Related-Bug: #1815989

messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-09-03 03:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-09-03 09:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6914, 'date': '2020-09-03 15:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-03 03:08:29.000000000', 'message': "pep8: Cap isort version to <5

isort 5.0.0 is not API compatible with isort 4.0.0,
and our current pep8 job result has a lot of warnings:
module 'isort' has no attribute 'SortImports'.
A newer version of pylint has a version cap for isort, but
updating pylint version needs extra works.
Using isort 4.x looks like an easy workaround for us.

Change-Id: I0c6c9c60901cc6be012780e8e1399dab69b50a47
"}]
commit_message:
pep8: Cap isort version to <5

isort 5.0.0 is not API compatible with isort 4.0.0,
and our current pep8 job result has a lot of warnings:
module 'isort' has no attribute 'SortImports'.
A newer version of pylint has a version cap for isort, but
updating pylint version needs extra works.
Using isort 4.x looks like an easy workaround for us.

Change-Id: I0c6c9c60901cc6be012780e8e1399dab69b50a47

[{'created': '2020-09-01 14:12:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use of ngettext in registry getName

The setNames and getNames functions in the resource registry were
calling ngettext() on already translated strings that were marked for

page titles in some locales being displayed as single characters.

commit_message:
Fix use of ngettext in registry getName

The setNames and getNames functions in the resource registry were
calling ngettext() on already translated strings that were marked for
translation with gettext() and not ngetttext(). That lead to some
page titles in some locales being displayed as single characters.

Closes-Bug: #1762089
Change-Id: I0ef365e0c0de6ae27a2e80bcb5257132f8c6ba29
(cherry picked from commit ef4055e2888bb0fe67d64e9c422a31f925469200)

commit_message:
Use the native Zuul v3 jobs from blazar-tempest-plugin

The new base jobs moved to that repository.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/blazar-devstack-dsvm-py35/run-ipv6.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/blazar-devstack-dsvm/run.yaml
The legacy job definition received a few updates, hance the conflicts

Also, the jobs required a few branch-specific changes, like the creation
of two py3 jobs (the default here is py2).

> Thanks Dmitry, Julia and Shiv for the reviews. I have updated this
 > patch with some changes to include config parameters. I am working
 > on the testcases currently while it is under review.

The idea is to configure whether TLS verification should be enabled or disabled. Then if enabled, and a valid custom certificate path is provided the TLS verification is done with the certificate and if it fails to validate it now uses certificates from the standard location. If no custom certificate path is provided but "verify_certs" is True then the certificates from the standard location are used for verification.'}, {'account_id': 30100, 'date': '2020-07-30 10:23:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Allow HttpImageService to accept custom certificate

While validating and downloading image references, allow HttpImageService
to use config parameters to enable/disable TLS verification and to use custom
certificates on the secured connections.

Change-Id: I5f308271004a24203ecbbc1718ba9070ed65b960
Story: #2007939
Task: #40404

commit_message:
Remove unused vpn param from allocate_for_instance

Only nova network used the vpn arg of allocate_for_instance but since
that is purge from the codebase the vpn arg is unused.

This patch removes the unused parameter.

Change-Id: I8dfc3b2d8fd9f0756d19a0392443e519a0dd0c15

commit_message:
Ensure fip ip rules deleted when fip removed

The information needed to delete ip rules associated
with fips is held in memory between add and remove so
a restart of the l3-agent results in any fips that
existed before the restart having their ip rules
persist after the fips are removed. This patch
enures that an agent restart reloads this information
so that ip rules associated with a fip are correctly
removed when the fip is removed.

Change-Id: If656a703c996ccc7719b1b09d793c5bbdfd6f3c1
Closes-Bug: #1891673

commit_message:
Use Docker Python SDK to manage containers

This patch reimplements docker container management by python, because
we no longer require SUID binary built from C.
This helps us to implement some more logics based on configuration
parameters and also add some more test coverage.

Change-Id: I86bb88fcd556326d2fa70f9a7a7c6f770c224361

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-40805 : FAILURE in 2h 39m 25s'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-05-14 07:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

i feel like this should have a release note and maybe be tracked via a specless blueprint.

this is technically an api behavior change so im also unclear if this need a microversion or not i would argue no but i belive technically it should.

overall im unsure if we want to force a refresh on the exising event but i do understand the usecase and when you would want to do this.
we get at least 1 but i think actully several netwrok-changed events during the boot process so im not sure that forceing a cache refresh on each of them is ideal.

in theory it should not be required as we now force referesh the network info cache in the periodic task if im not mistaken.
that siad i think this chagne is worth discusing futher and perhaps we shoudl ahve a new event sepcific to force a referesh instead?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-14 20:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

From API behaviour wise this is fine and does not need microversion bump. This is changing the behaviour of refreshing cache from neutron or from nova DB which does not change API behaviour. and getting latest info from neutron is right thing when there is network-change event (without port).

But i am concern over the mentioned use case of this API for refreshing the cache by operator. holding +2 till we decide that is right usage of this API.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-14 20:18:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

While I understand the desire to be able to initiate a cache refresh, the question I have is: what problem are you looking to solve by doing this? I think we need to start with that to determine what's the appropriate change to make.

We already have a periodic refresh of info cache [1], so I'm wondering what problem are you seeing that isn't already being covered?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ef3b5707328f460d0d03759061c01b1a20f28743/nova/compute/manager.py#L8941"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-05-15 16:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11583, 'date': '2020-05-18 13:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> While I understand the desire to be able to initiate a cache
 > refresh, the question I have is: what problem are you looking to
 > solve by doing this? I think we need to start with that to
 > determine what's the appropriate change to make.
 > 
 > We already have a periodic refresh of info cache [1], so I'm
 > wondering what problem are you seeing that isn't already being
 > covered?
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ef3b5707328f460d0d03759061c01b1a20f28743/nova/compute/manager.py#L8941



Unfortunately, I dont remember exactly the details that forced me to apply this patch on my side, but somehow a race condition between nova and neutron that prevent the cache to be correct.

About the auto_heal mecanism, correct me if I am wrong, but it's healing instance 1 by 1.
On some hypervisors, I have 120 instances, with auto_heal set to every minute, I will have to wait 2 hours before all instances are healed.

About the fact that I use this network-changed event, I know that this is a trick, and I agree that this should not be used.
The best would be an admin API call to force refresh info cache.
What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-05-18 14:29:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

so the heal operation is implemented here

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3b4fa6108f07ff4660f61a51b932cb5296f7c79a/nova/compute/manager.py#L8943-L9050

and yes on each invocation it update once instance as a form eof rate limiting.

the default value of the interval is 60 seconds

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9969332de6dbb10b495a74d4bc3ce7b77be13f22/nova/conf/compute.py#L999-L1016

so you could reduce that to 1 second or 10 seconds if you wanted to reduce the time intercal form 2 hours to 2 minutes or 20 minutes.

i dont think we shoudl have a rest api to roce refresh the cache honestly. but we should support doing it via a SIGHUP

we support using SIGHUP to clear several cache's already

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/33c3759b855b621875d9d79d103bd30f356198ae/releasenotes/notes/disable-rt-cache-refresh-9f6633e585516760.yaml#L10

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9692f16b357918eed8b56f3af2e002f5b898238a/releasenotes/notes/driver-capabilities-to-traits-152eb851cd016f4d.yaml#L25

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c6218428e9b29a2c52808ec7d27b4b21aadc0299/releasenotes/notes/stop-scheduling-to-disabled-cells-eadbfe30d1f6be65.yaml#L15"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-19 20:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

reno and doc is need anyways with clear use case. But let's not assume that this API is for instance info cache refresh."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-19 20:28:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> so the heal operation is implemented here
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3b4fa6108f07ff4660f61a51b932cb5296f7c79a/nova/compute/manager.py#L8943-L9050
 > 
 > and yes on each invocation it update once instance as a form eof
 > rate limiting.
 > 
 > the default value of the interval is 60 seconds
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9969332de6dbb10b495a74d4bc3ce7b77be13f22/nova/conf/compute.py#L999-L1016
 > 
 > so you could reduce that to 1 second or 10 seconds if you wanted to
 > reduce the time intercal form 2 hours to 2 minutes or 20 minutes.
 > 
 > i dont think we shoudl have a rest api to roce refresh the cache
 > honestly. but we should support doing it via a SIGHUP
 > 
 > we support using SIGHUP to clear several cache's already
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/33c3759b855b621875d9d79d103bd30f356198ae/releasenotes/notes/disable-rt-cache-refresh-9f6633e585516760.yaml#L10
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9692f16b357918eed8b56f3af2e002f5b898238a/releasenotes/notes/driver-capabilities-to-traits-152eb851cd016f4d.yaml#L25
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c6218428e9b29a2c52808ec7d27b4b21aadc0299/releasenotes/notes/stop-scheduling-to-disabled-cells-eadbfe30d1f6be65.yaml#L15

+1 to the suggestion to clear this cache as part of our SIGHUP routine instead of overloading it into the external events API. I think that sounds most appropriate and consistent with the way that we clear other caches."}, {'account_id': 11583, 'date': '2020-09-08 09:45:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> so the heal operation is implemented here
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3b4fa6108f07ff4660f61a51b932cb5296f7c79a/nova/compute/manager.py#L8943-L9050
 > 
 > and yes on each invocation it update once instance as a form eof
 > rate limiting.
 > 
 > the default value of the interval is 60 seconds
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9969332de6dbb10b495a74d4bc3ce7b77be13f22/nova/conf/compute.py#L999-L1016
 > 
 > so you could reduce that to 1 second or 10 seconds if you wanted to
 > reduce the time intercal form 2 hours to 2 minutes or 20 minutes.
 > 
 > i dont think we shoudl have a rest api to roce refresh the cache
 > honestly. but we should support doing it via a SIGHUP
 > 
 > we support using SIGHUP to clear several cache's already
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/33c3759b855b621875d9d79d103bd30f356198ae/releasenotes/notes/disable-rt-cache-refresh-9f6633e585516760.yaml#L10
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9692f16b357918eed8b56f3af2e002f5b898238a/releasenotes/notes/driver-capabilities-to-traits-152eb851cd016f4d.yaml#L25
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c6218428e9b29a2c52808ec7d27b4b21aadc0299/releasenotes/notes/stop-scheduling-to-disabled-cells-eadbfe30d1f6be65.yaml#L15

The problem by setting the interval to few seconds is that it's overloading API.
And I dont need most of the time to refresh the cache.

I have one example right now on my production infra:
It started with a misconfiguration of the subnet on neutron side.
The subnet was having enable_dhcp set to false.
I updated the subnet in order to set it to True.
I rebooted-hard my instance hoping that this new setting on subnet would be taken into account.
It's not, because the cache in nova is not yet updated.
I have no way to reset this cache for now. I did try:
 - restart nova-compute
 - delete the cache entry in the DB --> nova is recreating the cache, but with empty values, it's not calling neutron. Anyway, deleting in the DB is not/never a good idea.

The only solution for me is to wait for the cache to be refreshed (and waiting for the heal is very long).
I have two solution:
 - live patch my nova.conf to set a heal to few seconds, and wait for the heal to be done on all instances
 - apply the change in this PR and do send an event.

You mentionned a solution with SIGHUP, but, correct me if I am wrong, it's not yet implemented, and it would refresh cache for all instances? Thus it would ddos neutron API on nova-compute restart?"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-08 10:05:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > so the heal operation is implemented here
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3b4fa6108f07ff4660f61a51b932cb5296f7c79a/nova/compute/manager.py#L8943-L9050
 > >
 > > and yes on each invocation it update once instance as a form eof
 > > rate limiting.
 > >
 > > the default value of the interval is 60 seconds
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9969332de6dbb10b495a74d4bc3ce7b77be13f22/nova/conf/compute.py#L999-L1016
 > >
 > > so you could reduce that to 1 second or 10 seconds if you wanted
 > to
 > > reduce the time intercal form 2 hours to 2 minutes or 20 minutes.
 > >
 > > i dont think we shoudl have a rest api to roce refresh the cache
 > > honestly. but we should support doing it via a SIGHUP
 > >
 > > we support using SIGHUP to clear several cache's already
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/33c3759b855b621875d9d79d103bd30f356198ae/releasenotes/notes/disable-rt-cache-refresh-9f6633e585516760.yaml#L10
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9692f16b357918eed8b56f3af2e002f5b898238a/releasenotes/notes/driver-capabilities-to-traits-152eb851cd016f4d.yaml#L25
 > >
 > > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c6218428e9b29a2c52808ec7d27b4b21aadc0299/releasenotes/notes/stop-scheduling-to-disabled-cells-eadbfe30d1f6be65.yaml#L15
 > 
 > The problem by setting the interval to few seconds is that it's
 > overloading API.
 > And I dont need most of the time to refresh the cache.
 > 
 > I have one example right now on my production infra:
 > It started with a misconfiguration of the subnet on neutron side.
 > The subnet was having enable_dhcp set to false.
 > I updated the subnet in order to set it to True.
 > I rebooted-hard my instance hoping that this new setting on subnet
 > would be taken into account.

setting enable_dhcp wont have any effect on the info in the nova cache and it should not

having enable_dhcp false does not affect the assignment of ips to a vm it just does not advertise
the ip to the vm over the dhcp protocol at the network level but it will still be populated in the
fixed_ip list in the neutron port.

 > It's not, because the cache in nova is not yet updated.
 > I have no way to reset this cache for now. I did try:
 > - restart nova-compute
 > - delete the cache entry in the DB --> nova is recreating the
 > cache, but with empty values, it's not calling neutron. Anyway,
 > deleting in the DB is not/never a good idea.

your concrete example does not make sense the cache will have no baring on
if the vm recives an ip via dhcp. it is not involed in that operation at all.
 > 
 > The only solution for me is to wait for the cache to be refreshed
 > (and waiting for the heal is very long).
 > I have two solution:
 > - live patch my nova.conf to set a heal to few seconds, and wait
 > for the heal to be done on all instances
 > - apply the change in this PR and do send an event.

the change in this patchset should not correct your ip issue so unless you can
explain exactly what is broken and how this fixes it i still think this approach is incorrect.

 > 
 > You mentionned a solution with SIGHUP, but, correct me if I am
 > wrong, it's not yet implemented, and it would refresh cache for all
 > instances? Thus it would ddos neutron API on nova-compute restart?

correct its not implmented we were suggusting that you implemented it instead of this patch.
and no it would not ddos the neutron api anymore then the periodic task does
or restarting the agent does today. it would only clear the entries for instance running
on the current host and it would just refersh the info cache for those vms."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-08 10:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

by the way the subnet info in the network info cache
was mainly present for nova-networks and in partcalar the nova firewall driver that implemented anti spoof protections.

both the firewall driver and nova-networks were removed last cycle so currently we dont use the subnet info in the VIF for networking currently.

its only use in nova today is to pass to os-vif which only uses it in the linux bridge pluging for firewalling what is not obsulete with the nova networks removal and its other use is for the metadata service.

so nova uses the subnet info to populate the metadta in teh api and config drive though we might not use the cache for that. it was primarly in the cache for nova networks which no longer exits and is not your usecase.'}]

commit_message:
Force refresh of instance info cache on event

If, for some reason, nova already have an info cache, then it would
not refresh it (even if it is wrong).

So, when nova receive an external event network-changed, I propose to
refresh the instance info cache, to be sure that what nova stores in
its database is taken from neutron.

This will also help operators managing wrong info cache, by doing an
http request against nova event API (admin only) in order to force
triggering this info cache update.

Change-Id: I9bbcfc0dd008162499e65437a689574b80e5c18a
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-07 21:25:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix is_same_callback() testing for python3.8

Python3.8 onwards, comparision of bound methods is
changed. It no longer decide the bound method's equality based
on their bounded objects equality instead it checks the identity
of their '__self__'.

Details about this behavior change in python 3.8
- https://bugs.python.org/issue1617161
- python-dev discussion: https://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-dev/2018-June/153959.html

So python3.8 onwards, 'strict' arg has no meaning. For backward compatibility
for python <3.8, we can keep the 'strict' arg but with deprecation warning.

Also modify the is_same_callback() unit tests to verify the 'strict'
arg based on python version.

Change-Id: I3e6d9bbceccacddd0e1a514bbe5d0722a3408ecb
Closes-Bug: #1841072
"}]
commit_message:
Fix is_same_callback() testing for python3.8

Python3.8 onwards, comparision of bound methods is
changed. It no longer decide the bound method's equality based
on their bounded objects equality instead it checks the identity
of their '__self__'.

Details about this behavior change in python 3.8
- https://bugs.python.org/issue1617161
- python-dev discussion: https://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-dev/2018-June/153959.html

So python3.8 onwards, 'strict' arg has no meaning. For backward compatibility
for python <3.8, we can keep the 'strict' arg but with deprecation warning.

Also modify the is_same_callback() unit tests to verify the 'strict'
arg based on python version.

Change-Id: I3e6d9bbceccacddd0e1a514bbe5d0722a3408ecb
Closes-Bug: #1841072

commit_message:
Use UUID for mounted SwiftRawDisks

When SwiftRawDisks is set, try to mount the disks using uuids instead of
paths. This makes mounts more stable, eg. if a kernel gets updates and
device orders are changed.

This patch will also update existing entries in /etc/fstab and replaces
the device path with the corresponding UUID.

Change-Id: I275b962447015e804638ccf85c63a22d1bb6e3d6

commit_message:
Delete non tag related device metadata during detach

When the blueprint virt-device-tagged-attach-detach [1] was
implemented the metadata cleanup during interface detach made an
assumption that metadata only exists if the detached vif has tags.
However metadata exists for vif with vlan information as well. In such
case the metadata is leaked during interface detach. This patch removes
this assumption from the detach code path.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/415520

Closes-Bug: #1887799
Change-Id: Iefdf9c8b024db04867bd5f8794863f0cd65de807

commit_message:
Drop KUBE_API_PORT for kube-apiserver

From k8s v1.19.x, kube-apiserver binary can't accept any parameter,
and actually we're not using the pass-in KUBE_API_PORT. So it's
safe to drop it.

Change-Id: I12a0bb3441d18c3b68a8db4ab3234e04e5218cd2

commit_message:
Fix centos-8 standalone-upgrade-ussuri for docker-ha train

Ensure we are deploying train with ha enabled per related
bug otherwise upgrading to ussuri fails. The depends-on
updates for os-tempest and reduces tests.

Related-Bug: 1887159
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/749486
Change-Id: I25e55c3320bc72f731512f7e6444ef61acce2a70

[{'created': '2020-07-06 10:06:12.000000000', 'message': "Check timestamps received and sent during container replication

On the receiver, check that timestamps are valid, else abort
replication.
On the sender, check that timestamps are valid before making the http

commit_message:
Check timestamps received and sent during container replication

On the receiver, check that timestamps are valid, else abort
replication.
On the sender, check that timestamps are valid before making the http
request, and quarantine the DB is they're not.

Change-Id: Ie3b62b89f891f4403533f6e05057d9119d7d4522
